[I]119-lestrade will give [you]1835-you a proof of [my]119-lestrade knowledge . Could [you]1835-you lay [your]1835-you hand upon those pills ? "[119-lestrade]

" [I]119-lestrade have them , "[119-lestrade] said [Lestrade]119-lestrade , producing a small white box ; " [I]110-holmes took them and the purse and the telegram , intending to have them put in a place of safety at [the Police Station]1836-the police station . It was the merest chance [my]110-holmes taking these pills , for [I]110-holmes am bound to say that [I]110-holmes do not attach any importance to them . "[110-holmes]

" Give them here , "[110-holmes] said [Holmes]110-holmes . " Now , [Doctor]1519-doctor , "[110-holmes] turning to [me]0-i , " are those ordinary pills ? "[0-i]

They certainly were not . They were of a pearly grey colour , small , round , and almost transparent against the light . " From their lightness and transparency , [I]110-holmes should imagine that they are soluble in water , "[110-holmes] [I]0-i remarked .

" Precisely so , "[110-holmes] answered [Holmes]110-holmes . " Now would [you]0-i mind going down and fetching that poor little devil of a terrier which has been bad so long , and which [the landlady]317-the landlady wanted [you]0-i to put out of its pain yesterday . "[110-holmes]

[I]0-i went [downstairs]529-downstairs and carried the dog [upstairs]1805-upstairs in [my]0-i arms . [Its]559-its laboured breathing and glazing eye showed that it was not far from its end . Indeed , its snow - white muzzle proclaimed that it had already exceeded the usual term of canine existence . [I]0-i placed it upon a cushion on the rug .

" [I]110-holmes will now cut one of these pills in two , "[110-holmes] said [Holmes]110-holmes , and drawing [his]110-holmes penknife [he]110-holmes suited the action to the word . " One half [we]1839-we return into the box for future purposes . The other half [I]119-lestrade will place in this wine glass , in which is a teaspoonful of water . [You]0-i perceive that [[our]1839-we friend]1840-our friend , [the Doctor]1841-the doctor , is right , and that it readily dissolves . "[119-lestrade]

" This may be very interesting , "[119-lestrade] said [Lestrade]119-lestrade , in the injured tone of one who suspects that [he]119-lestrade is being laughed at , " [I]110-holmes can not see , however , what it has to do with the death of [Mr. Joseph Stangerson]128-stangerson . "[110-holmes]

" Patience , [[my]110-holmes friend]334-my friend , patience ! [You]0-i will find in time that it has everything to do with it . [I]110-holmes shall now add a little milk to make the mixture palatable , and on presenting it to the dog [we]1839-we find that [he]110-holmes laps it up readily enough . "[110-holmes]

As [he]110-holmes spoke [he]110-holmes turned the contents of the wine glass into a saucer and placed it in front of the terrier , who speedily licked it dry . [Sherlock Holmes]110-holmes ' earnest demeanour had so far convinced [us]560-us that [we]560-us all sat in silence , watching the animal intently , and expecting some startling effect . None such appeared , however . The dog continued to lie stretched upon the cushion , breathing in a laboured way , but apparently neither the better nor the worse for its draught .

[Holmes]110-holmes had taken out [his]110-holmes watch , and as minute followed minute without result , an expression of the utmost chagrin and disappointment appeared upon [his]110-holmes features . [He]110-holmes gnawed [his]110-holmes lip , drummed [his]110-holmes fingers upon the table , and showed every other symptom of acute impatience . So great was [his]110-holmes emotion , that [I]0-i felt sincerely sorry for [him]110-holmes , while [the two detectives]412-the two detectives smiled derisively , by no means displeased at this check which [he]110-holmes had met .

" It ca n't be a coincidence , "[110-holmes] [he]110-holmes cried , at last springing from [his]110-holmes chair and pacing wildly up and down [the room]259-the room ; " it is impossible that it should be a mere coincidence . The very pills which [I]110-holmes suspected in the case of [Drebber]123-drebber are actually found after the death of [Stangerson]128-stangerson . And yet they are inert . What can it mean ? Surely [my]110-holmes whole chain of reasoning can not have been false . It is impossible ! And yet this wretched dog is none the worse . Ah , [I]110-holmes have it ! [I]110-holmes have it ! "[110-holmes] With a perfect shriek of delight [he]110-holmes rushed to the box , cut the other pill in two , dissolved it , added milk , and presented it to [the terrier]563-the terrier . [The unfortunate creature]564-the unfortunate creature 's tongue seemed hardly to have been moistened in it before it gave a convulsive shiver in every limb , and lay as rigid and lifeless as if it had been struck by lightning .

[Sherlock Holmes]110-holmes drew a long breath , and wiped the perspiration from [his]110-holmes forehead . " [I]110-holmes should have more faith , "[110-holmes] [he]110-holmes said ; " [I]110-holmes ought to know by this time that when a fact appears to be opposed to a long train of deductions , it invariably proves to be capable of bearing some other interpretation . Of the two pills in that box one was of the most deadly poison , and the other was entirely harmless . [I]110-holmes ought to have known that before ever [I]110-holmes saw the box at all . "[110-holmes]

This last statement appeared to [me]0-i to be so startling , that [I]0-i could hardly believe that [he]110-holmes was in [his]110-holmes sober senses . There was the dead dog , however , to prove that [his]110-holmes conjecture had been correct . It seemed to [me]0-i that the mists in [my]0-i own mind were gradually clearing away , and [I]0-i began to have a dim , vague perception of the truth .

" All this seems strange to [you]0-i , "[110-holmes] continued [Holmes]110-holmes , " because [you]0-i failed at the beginning of the inquiry to grasp the importance of the single real clue which was presented to [you]0-i . [I]110-holmes had the good fortune to seize upon that , and everything which has occurred since then has served to confirm [my]110-holmes original supposition , and , indeed , was the logical sequence of it . Hence things which have perplexed [you]0-i and made the case more obscure , have served to enlighten [me]110-holmes and to strengthen [my]110-holmes conclusions . It is a mistake to confound strangeness with mystery . The most commonplace crime is often the most mysterious because it presents no new or special features from which deductions may be drawn . This murder would have been infinitely more difficult to unravel had the body of [the victim]453-the victim been simply found lying in [the roadway]332-the roadway without any of those _ outr _ and sensational accompaniments which have rendered it remarkable . These strange details , far from making the case more difficult , have really had the effect of making it less so . "[110-holmes]

[Mr. Gregson]130-gregson , who had listened to this address with considerable impatience , could contain [himself]130-gregson no longer . " Look here , [Mr. Sherlock Holmes]110-holmes , "[110-holmes] [he]110-holmes said , " [we]1845-we are all ready to acknowledge that [you]110-holmes are [a smart man]1846-a smart man , and that [you]110-holmes have [your]110-holmes own methods of working . [We]1845-we want something more than mere theory and preaching now , though . It is a case of taking [the man]1387-the man . [I]119-lestrade have made [my]119-lestrade case out , and it seems [I]119-lestrade was wrong . [Young Charpentier]165-young charpentier could not have been engaged in this second affair . [Lestrade]119-lestrade went after [[his]119-lestrade man]1848-his man , [Stangerson]128-stangerson , and it appears that [he]119-lestrade was wrong too . [You]110-holmes have thrown out hints here , and hints there , and seem to know more than [we]1845-we do , but the time has come when [we]1845-we feel that [we]1845-we have a right to ask [you]110-holmes straight how much [you]110-holmes do know of the business . Can [you]110-holmes name [the man who did it]1849-the man who did it ? "[119-lestrade]

" [I]119-lestrade can not help feeling that [Gregson]130-gregson is right , [sir]1431-sir , "[119-lestrade] remarked [Lestrade]119-lestrade . " [We]1845-we have both tried , and [we]1845-we have both failed . [You]110-holmes have remarked more than once since [I]0-i have been in [the room]259-the room that [you]110-holmes had all the evidence which [you]110-holmes require . Surely [you]110-holmes will not withhold it any longer . "[0-i]

" Any delay in arresting [the assassin]1852-the assassin , "[0-i] [I]0-i observed , " might give [him]1852-the assassin time to perpetrate some fresh atrocity . "[110-holmes]

Thus pressed by [us]565-us all , [Holmes]110-holmes showed signs of irresolution . [He]110-holmes continued to walk up and down [the room]259-the room with [his]110-holmes head sunk on [his]110-holmes chest and [his]110-holmes brows drawn down , as was [his]110-holmes habit when lost in thought .

" There will be no more murders , "[110-holmes] [he]110-holmes said at last , stopping abruptly and facing [us]565-us . " [You]110-holmes can put that consideration out of the question . [You]110-holmes have asked [me]572-the spokesman of the street arabs if [I]572-the spokesman of the street arabs know the name of [the assassin]1852-the assassin . [I]572-the spokesman of the street arabs do . The mere knowing of [his]1852-the assassin name is a small thing , however , compared with the power of laying [our]565-us hands upon [him]1852-the assassin . This [I]572-the spokesman of the street arabs expect very shortly to do . [I]572-the spokesman of the street arabs have good hopes of managing it through [my]572-the spokesman of the street arabs own arrangements ; but it is a thing which needs delicate handling , for [we]565-us have [a shrewd and desperate man]1854-a shrewd and desperate man to deal with , who is supported , as [I]572-the spokesman of the street arabs have had occasion to prove , by [another who is as clever as [himself]1855-another who is as clever as himself]1855-another who is as clever as himself . As long as [this man]287-this man has no idea that [anyone]1332-anyone can have a clue there is some chance of securing [him]287-this man ; but if [he]287-this man had the slightest suspicion , [he]287-this man would change [his]287-this man name , and vanish in an instant among [the four million inhabitants of [this great city]1859-this great city]1858-the four million inhabitants of this great city . Without meaning to hurt either of [your]1860-your feelings , [I]572-the spokesman of the street arabs am bound to say that [I]572-the spokesman of the street arabs consider [these men]515-these men to be more than a match for [the official force]1862-the official force , and that is why [I]572-the spokesman of the street arabs have not asked [your]1860-your assistance . If [I]572-the spokesman of the street arabs fail [I]572-the spokesman of the street arabs shall , of course , incur all the blame due to this omission ; but that [I]572-the spokesman of the street arabs am prepared for . At present [I]572-the spokesman of the street arabs am ready to promise that the instant that [I]572-the spokesman of the street arabs can communicate with [you]1860-your without endangering [my]572-the spokesman of the street arabs own combinations , [I]572-the spokesman of the street arabs shall do so . "[572-the spokesman of the street arabs]

[Gregson]130-gregson and [Lestrade]119-lestrade seemed to be far from satisfied by this assurance , or by the depreciating allusion to [the detective police]567-the detective police . [The former]414-the former had flushed up to the roots of [his]414-the former flaxen hair , while [the other]569-the other 's beady eyes glistened with curiosity and resentment . [Neither of [them]571-them]570-neither of them had time to speak , however , before there was a tap at the door , and [the spokesman of [the street Arabs]573-the street arabs]572-the spokesman of the street arabs , [young Wiggins]154-wiggins , introduced [[his]154-wiggins insignificant and unsavoury person]574-his insignificant and unsavoury person .

" Please , [sir]1431-sir , "[572-the spokesman of the street arabs] [he]572-the spokesman of the street arabs said , touching [his]572-the spokesman of the street arabs forelock , " [I]110-holmes have [the cab]1529-the cab [downstairs]529-downstairs . "[110-holmes]

" [Good boy]1866-good boy , "[572-the spokesman of the street arabs] said [Holmes]110-holmes , blandly . " Why do n't [you]110-holmes introduce this pattern at [Scotland Yard]48-scotland yard ? "[572-the spokesman of the street arabs] [he]572-the spokesman of the street arabs continued , taking a pair of steel handcuffs from a drawer . " See how beautifully the spring works . They fasten in an instant . "[119-lestrade]

" The old pattern is good enough , "[119-lestrade] remarked [Lestrade]119-lestrade , " if [we]1867-we can only find [the man to put them on]1868-the man to put them on . "[110-holmes]

" Very good , very good , "[110-holmes] said [Holmes]110-holmes , smiling . " [The cabman]1869-the cabman may as well help [me]243-my companion with [my]243-my companion boxes . Just ask [him]243-my companion to step up , [Wiggins]154-wiggins . "[243-my companion]

[I]0-i was surprised to find [[my]0-i companion]243-my companion speaking as though [he]243-my companion were about to set out on a journey , since [he]243-my companion had not said anything to [me]0-i about it . There was a small portmanteau in [the room]259-the room , and this [he]243-my companion pulled out and began to strap . [He]243-my companion was busily engaged at it when [the cabman]1869-the cabman entered [the room]259-the room .

" Just give [me]110-holmes a help with this buckle , [cabman]1870-cabman , "[110-holmes] [he]243-my companion said , kneeling over [his]243-my companion task , and never turning [his]243-my companion head .

[The fellow]1377-the fellow came forward with a somewhat sullen , defiant air , and put down [his]243-my companion hands to assist . At that instant there was a sharp click , the jangling of metal , and [Sherlock Holmes]110-holmes sprang to [his]110-holmes feet again .

" [Gentlemen]1871-gentlemen , "[110-holmes] [he]110-holmes cried , with flashing eyes , " let [me]110-holmes introduce [you]1871-gentlemen to [Mr. Jefferson Hope]166-jefferson hope , [the murderer of [Enoch Drebber]123-drebber]1872-the murderer of enoch drebber and of [Joseph Stangerson]128-stangerson . "[110-holmes]

The whole thing occurred in a moment - so quickly that [I]0-i had no time to realize it . [I]0-i have a vivid recollection of that instant , of [Holmes]110-holmes ' triumphant expression and the ring of [his]110-holmes voice , of [the cabman]1869-the cabman 's dazed , savage face , as [he]110-holmes glared at the glittering handcuffs , which had appeared as if by magic upon [his]110-holmes wrists . For a second or two [we]581-we might have been a group of statues . Then , with an inarticulate roar of fury , [the prisoner]582-the prisoner wrenched [himself]582-the prisoner free from [Holmes]110-holmes 's grasp , and hurled [himself]582-the prisoner through the window . Woodwork and glass gave way before [him]582-the prisoner ; but before [he]582-the prisoner got quite through , [Gregson]130-gregson , [Lestrade]119-lestrade , and [Holmes]110-holmes sprang upon [him]582-the prisoner like so many staghounds . [He]582-the prisoner was dragged back into [the room]259-the room , and then commenced a terrific conflict . So powerful and so fierce was [he]582-the prisoner , that [the four of [us]581-we]584-the four of us were shaken off again and again . [He]582-the prisoner appeared to have the convulsive strength of [a man]226-a man in an epileptic fit . [His]582-the prisoner face and hands were terribly mangled by [his]582-the prisoner passage through the glass , but loss of blood had no effect in diminishing [his]582-the prisoner resistance . It was not until [Lestrade]119-lestrade succeeded in getting [his]582-the prisoner hand inside [his]582-the prisoner neckcloth and half - strangling [him]582-the prisoner that [we]581-we made [him]582-the prisoner realize that [his]582-the prisoner struggles were of no avail ; and even then [we]581-we felt no security until [we]581-we had pinioned [his]582-the prisoner feet as well as [his]582-the prisoner hands . That done , [we]581-we rose to [our]581-we feet breathless and panting .

" [We]581-we have [[his]582-the prisoner cab]1873-his cab , "[110-holmes] said [Sherlock Holmes]110-holmes . " It will serve to take [him]582-the prisoner to [Scotland Yard]48-scotland yard . And now , [gentlemen]1871-gentlemen , "[110-holmes] [he]110-holmes continued , with a pleasant smile , " [we]581-we have reached the end of [our]581-we little mystery . [You]1871-gentlemen are very welcome to put any questions that [you]1871-gentlemen like to [me]1387-the man now , and there is no danger that [I]1387-the man will refuse to answer them . "[1387-the man]

PART II . _ [The Country of [the Saints]586-the saints]60-the country of the saints . _

In [the central portion of [the great North American Continent]61-the great north american continent]587-the central portion of the great north american continent there lies [an arid and repulsive desert]588-an arid and repulsive desert , which for many a long year served as a barrier against the advance of civilisation . From [the Sierra Nevada]62-the sierra nevada to [Nebraska]63-nebraska , and from [the Yellowstone River]64-the yellowstone river in the north to [the Colorado]65-the colorado upon [the south]589-the south , is [a region of desolation and silence]590-a region of desolation and silence . Nor is Nature always in one mood throughout [this grim district]591-this grim district . [It]590-a region of desolation and silence comprises [snow - capped and lofty mountains]592-snow - capped and lofty mountains , and [dark and gloomy valleys]593-dark and gloomy valleys . There are swift - flowing rivers which dash through jagged caons ; and there are [enormous plains , which in winter are white with snow , and in summer are grey with the saline alkali dust]594-enormous plains , which in winter are white with snow , and in summer are grey with the saline alkali dust . They all preserve , however , the common characteristics of barrenness , inhospitality , and misery .

There are [no inhabitants of [this land of despair]596-this land of despair]595-no inhabitants of this land of despair . [A band of [Pawnees]167-pawnees or of Blackfeet]597-a band of pawnees or of blackfeet may occasionally traverse [it]596-this land of despair in order to reach [other hunting - grounds]598-other hunting - grounds , but [the hardiest of [the braves]600-the braves]599-the hardiest of the braves are glad to lose sight of [those awesome plains]601-those awesome plains , and to find [themselves]599-the hardiest of the braves once more upon [[their]599-the hardiest of the braves prairies]602-their prairies . The coyote skulks among the scrub , the buzzard flaps heavily through the air , and the clumsy grizzly bear lumbers through [the dark ravines]603-the dark ravines , and picks up such sustenance as it can amongst the rocks . These are [the sole dwellers in [the wilderness]605-the wilderness]604-the sole dwellers in the wilderness .

In [the whole world]606-the whole world there can be no more dreary view than that from [the northern slope of [the Sierra Blanco]66-the sierra blanco]607-the northern slope of the sierra blanco . As far as the eye can reach stretches [the great flat plain - land]608-the great flat plain - land , all dusted over with patches of alkali , and intersected by clumps of the dwarfish chaparral bushes . On the extreme verge of the horizon lie a long chain of mountain peaks , with [their]609-their rugged summits flecked with snow . In [this great stretch of country]610-this great stretch of country there is no sign of life , nor of anything appertaining to life . There is no bird in the steel - blue heaven , no movement upon [the dull , grey earth]611-the dull , grey earth - above all , there is absolute silence . Listen as [one]386-one may , there is no shadow of a sound in [all that mighty wilderness]613-all that mighty wilderness ; nothing but silence - complete and heart - subduing silence .

It has been said there is nothing appertaining to life upon [the broad plain]614-the broad plain . That is hardly true . Looking down from [the Sierra Blanco]615-the sierra blanco , [one]386-one sees a pathway traced out across [the desert]616-the desert , which winds away and is lost in the extreme distance . [It]617-it is rutted with wheels and trodden down by the feet of [many adventurers]618-many adventurers . Here and there there are scattered white objects which glisten in the sun , and stand out against the dull deposit of alkali . Approach , and examine them ! They are bones : some large and coarse , others smaller and more delicate . The former have belonged to [oxen]619-oxen , and the latter to [men]1701-men . For fifteen hundred miles one may trace this ghastly caravan route by these scattered remains of [those who had fallen by the wayside]621-those who had fallen by the wayside .

Looking down on this very scene , there stood upon the fourth of May , eighteen hundred and forty - seven , [a solitary traveller]622-a solitary traveller . [His]622-a solitary traveller appearance was such that [he]622-a solitary traveller might have been [the very genius or demon of [the region]624-the region]623-the very genius or demon of the region . [An observer]625-an observer would have found it difficult to say whether [he]622-a solitary traveller was nearer to forty or to sixty . [His]622-a solitary traveller face was lean and haggard , and the brown parchment - like skin was drawn tightly over the projecting bones ; [his]622-a solitary traveller long , brown hair and beard were all flecked and dashed with white ; [his]622-a solitary traveller eyes were sunken in [his]622-a solitary traveller head , and burned with an unnatural lustre ; while the hand which grasped [his]622-a solitary traveller rifle was hardly more fleshy than that of a skeleton . As [he]622-a solitary traveller stood , [he]622-a solitary traveller leaned upon [his]622-a solitary traveller weapon for support , and yet [his]622-a solitary traveller tall figure and the massive framework of [his]622-a solitary traveller bones suggested a wiry and vigorous constitution . [His]622-a solitary traveller gaunt face , however , and [his]622-a solitary traveller clothes , which hung so baggily over [his]622-a solitary traveller shrivelled limbs , proclaimed what it was that gave [him]622-a solitary traveller that senile and decrepit appearance . [The man]1387-the man was dying - dying from hunger and from thirst .

[He]1387-the man had toiled painfully down [the ravine]627-the ravine , and on to this little elevation , in the vain hope of seeing some signs of water . Now [the great salt plain]628-the great salt plain stretched before [his]1387-the man eyes , and [the distant belt of savage mountains]629-the distant belt of savage mountains , without a sign anywhere of plant or tree , which might indicate the presence of moisture . In all that broad landscape there was no gleam of hope . North , and east , and west [he]1387-the man looked with wild questioning eyes , and then [he]1387-the man realised that [his]1387-the man wanderings had come to an end , and that there , on [that barren crag]630-that barren crag , [he]1387-the man was about to die . " Why not here , as well as in a feather bed , twenty years hence , "[632-the grey parcel] [he]1387-the man muttered , as [he]1387-the man seated [himself]1387-the man in the shelter of a boulder .

Before sitting down , [he]1387-the man had deposited upon [the ground]631-the ground [his]1387-the man useless rifle , and also a large bundle tied up in a grey shawl , which [he]1387-the man had carried slung over [his]1387-the man right shoulder . It appeared to be somewhat too heavy for [his]1387-the man strength , for in lowering it , it came down on the ground with some little violence . Instantly there broke from [the grey parcel]632-the grey parcel a little moaning cry , and from it there protruded [a small , scared face , with very bright brown eyes , and two little speckled , dimpled fists]633-a small , scared face , with very bright brown eyes , and two little speckled , dimpled fists .

" [You]1387-the man 've hurt [me]1387-the man ! "[1387-the man] said a childish voice reproachfully .

" Have [I]1387-the man though , "[1387-the man] [the man]1387-the man answered penitently , " [I]637-the child did n't go for to do it . "[637-the child] As [he]1387-the man spoke [he]1387-the man unwrapped the grey shawl and extricated [a pretty little girl of about five years of age]635-a pretty little girl of about five years of age , whose dainty shoes and smart pink frock with its little linen apron all bespoke [a mother]636-a mother 's care . [The child]637-the child was pale and wan , but [her]637-the child healthy arms and legs showed that [she]637-the child had suffered less than [[her]637-the child companion]638-her companion .

" How is it now ? "[637-the child] [he]1387-the man answered anxiously , for [she]637-the child was still rubbing the towsy golden curls which covered the back of [her]637-the child head .

" Kiss it and make it well , "[637-the child] [she]637-the child said , with perfect gravity , showing the injured part up to [him]1387-the man . " That 's what [mother]1736-mother used to do . Where 's [mother]1736-mother ? "[637-the child]

" [Mother]168-mother 's gone . [I]639-the little girl guess [you]1387-the man 'll see [her]1736-mother before long . "[639-the little girl]

" Gone , eh ! "[639-the little girl] said [the little girl]639-the little girl . " Funny , [she]1736-mother did n't say good - bye ; [she]1736-mother ' most always did if [she]1736-mother was just goin' over to [Auntie]1877-auntie 's for tea , and now [she]1736-mother 's been away three days . Say , it 's awful dry , ai n't it ? Ai n't there no water , nor nothing to eat ? "[637-the child]

" No , there ai n't nothing , [dearie]1878-dearie . [You]1878-dearie 'll just need to be patient awhile , and then [you]1878-dearie 'll be all right . Put [your]1878-dearie head up agin [me]639-the little girl like that , and then [you]1878-dearie 'll feel bullier . It ai n't easy to talk when [your]1878-dearie lips is like leather , but [I]639-the little girl guess [I]639-the little girl 'd best let [you]1878-dearie know how the cards lie . What 's that [you]1878-dearie 've got ? "[639-the little girl]

" Pretty things ! fine things ! "[639-the little girl] cried [the little girl]639-the little girl enthusiastically , holding up two glittering fragments of mica . " When [we]1879-we goes back to [home]1598-home [I]1387-the man 'll give them to [brother Bob]169-brother bob . "[1387-the man]

" [You]1878-dearie 'll see prettier things than [them]1881-them soon , "[1387-the man] said [the man]1387-the man confidently . " [You]1878-dearie just wait a bit . [I]637-the child was going to tell [you]1878-dearie though - [you]1878-dearie remember when [we]1879-we left [the river]1882-the river ? "[637-the child]

" Oh , yes . "[1387-the man]

" Well , [we]1879-we reckoned [we]1879-we 'd strike [another river]1883-another river soon , d'ye see . But there was somethin' wrong ; compasses , or map , or somethin' , and it did n't turn up . Water ran out . Just except a little drop for the likes of [you]1878-dearie and - and - - "[1387-the man]

" And [you]1878-dearie could n't wash [yourself]1878-dearie , "[1387-the man] interrupted [[his]1387-the man companion]1798-his companion gravely , staring up at [his]1387-the man grimy visage .

" No , nor drink . And [Mr. Bender]170-mr. bender , [he]170-mr. bender was the fust to go , and then [Indian Pete]171-indian pete , and then [Mrs. McGregor]172-mrs. mcgregor , and then [Johnny Hones]173-johnny hones , and then , dearie , [[your]1878-dearie mother]1884-your mother . "[639-the little girl]

" Then [mother]1736-mother 's a deader too , "[1387-the man] cried [the little girl]639-the little girl dropping [her]639-the little girl face in [her]639-the little girl pinafore and sobbing bitterly .

" Yes , [they]1886-they all went except [you]1387-the man and [me]637-the child . Then [I]637-the child thought there was some chance of water in this direction , so [I]637-the child heaved [you]1387-the man over [my]637-the child shoulder and [we]1887-we tramped it together . It do n't seem as though [we]1887-we 've improved matters . There 's an almighty small chance for [us]1887-we now ! "[637-the child]

For three days and three nights [he]1387-the man had allowed [himself]1387-the man neither rest nor repose . Slowly the eyelids drooped over the tired eyes , and the head sunk lower and lower upon the breast , until [the man]1387-the man 's grizzled beard was mixed with the gold tresses of [[his]1387-the man companion]1798-his companion , and both slept the same deep and dreamless slumber .

Had [the wanderer]666-the wanderer remained awake for another half hour a strange sight would have met [his]1387-the man eyes . Far away on [the extreme verge of [the alkali plain]668-the alkali plain]667-the extreme verge of the alkali plain there rose up a little spray of dust , very slight at first , and hardly to be distinguished from the mists of the distance , but gradually growing higher and broader until it formed a solid , well - defined cloud . This cloud continued to increase in size until it became evident that it could only be raised by a great multitude of moving creatures . In [more fertile spots]669-more fertile spots [the observer]670-the observer would have come to the conclusion that one of those great herds of bisons which graze upon [the prairie land]671-the prairie land was approaching [him]1387-the man . This was obviously impossible in [these arid wilds]672-these arid wilds . As the whirl of dust drew nearer to [the solitary bluff upon which [the two castaways]674-the two castaways were reposing]673-the solitary bluff upon which the two castaways were reposing , the canvas - covered tilts of waggons and [the figures of armed horsemen]675-the figures of armed horsemen began to show up through the haze , and the apparition revealed [itself]676-itself as being a great caravan upon [its]676-itself journey for [the West]651-the west . But what [a caravan]678-a caravan ! When the head of it had reached [the base of [the mountains]680-the mountains]679-the base of the mountains , the rear was not yet visible on the horizon . Right across [the enormous plain]681-the enormous plain stretched [the straggling array , waggons and carts]682-the straggling array , waggons and carts , [men on horseback]683-men on horseback , and [men on foot]684-men on foot . [Innumerable women who staggered along under burdens]685-innumerable women who staggered along under burdens , and [children who toddled beside the waggons or peeped out from under the white coverings]686-children who toddled beside the waggons or peeped out from under the white coverings . There rose through the clear air a confused clattering and rumbling from this great mass of humanity , with the creaking of wheels and the neighing of horses . Loud as it was , it was not sufficient to rouse [the two tired wayfarers]690-the two tired wayfarers above [them]674-the two castaways .

At the head of the column there rode [a score or more of grave ironfaced men , clad in sombre homespun garments and armed with rifles]691-a score or more of grave ironfaced men , clad in sombre homespun garments and armed with rifles . [Brigham Young]179-young has said it , and [he]179-young has spoken with the voice of [Joseph Smith]178-joseph smith , which is the voice of [God]159-god . "[879-her preserver]

This is not the place to commemorate the trials and privations endured by [the immigrant Mormons]770-the immigrant mormons before [they]770-the immigrant mormons came to [[their]770-the immigrant mormons final haven]771-their final haven . From [the shores of [the Mississippi]74-the mississippi]772-the shores of the mississippi to [the western slopes of [the Rocky Mountains]75-the rocky mountains [they]770-the immigrant mormons had struggled on]773-the western slopes of the rocky mountains they had struggled on with a constancy almost unparalleled in history . [The savage man]774-the savage man , and the savage beast , hunger , thirst , fatigue , and disease - every impediment which Nature could place in the way , had all been overcome with Anglo - Saxon tenacity . Yet the long journey and the accumulated terrors had shaken the hearts of [the stoutest among [them]770-the immigrant mormons]775-the stoutest among them . There was [not one who did not sink upon [his]776-not one who did not sink upon his knees in heartfelt prayer when they saw the broad valley of utah bathed in the sunlight beneath them , and learned from the lips of their leader that this was the promised land , and that these virgin acres were to be theirs for evermore knees in heartfelt prayer when [they]770-the immigrant mormons saw [the broad valley of [Utah]76-utah bathed in the sunlight beneath [them]770-the immigrant mormons]777-the broad valley of utah bathed in the sunlight beneath them , and learned from the lips of [[their]770-the immigrant mormons leader]778-their leader that this was [the promised land]779-the promised land , and that [these virgin acres]780-these virgin acres were to be theirs for evermore]776-not one who did not sink upon his knees in heartfelt prayer when they saw the broad valley of utah bathed in the sunlight beneath them , and learned from the lips of their leader that this was the promised land , and that these virgin acres were to be theirs for evermore .

[Young]179-young speedily proved [himself]179-young to be [a skilful administrator]781-a skilful administrator as well as [a resolute chief]782-a resolute chief . Maps were drawn and charts prepared , in which [the future city]783-the future city was sketched out . [All around farms]784-all around farms were apportioned and allotted in proportion to the standing of [each individual]785-each individual . [The tradesman]786-the tradesman was put to [his]786-the tradesman trade and [the artisan]787-the artisan to [his]786-the tradesman calling . In [the town]788-the town streets and [squares]789-squares sprang up , as if by magic . In [the country]231-the country there was draining and hedging , planting and clearing , until the next summer saw [the whole country]791-the whole country golden with the wheat crop . Everything prospered in [the strange settlement]792-the strange settlement . Above all , [the great temple which [they]794-they had erected in the centre of [the city]281-the city]793-the great temple which they had erected in the centre of the city grew ever taller and larger . From the first blush of dawn until the closing of the twilight , the clatter of the hammer and the rasp of the saw was never absent from the monument which [the immigrants]796-the immigrants erected to [[Him]179-young who had led [them]796-the immigrants safe through many dangers]797-him who had led them safe through many dangers .

[The two castaways]674-the two castaways , [John Ferrier]175-john ferrier and [the little girl who had shared [his]175-john ferrier fortunes and had been adopted as [[his]175-john ferrier daughter]800-his daughter]799-the little girl who had shared his fortunes and had been adopted as his daughter , accompanied [the Mormons]1920-the mormons to the end of [their]1920-the mormons great pilgrimage . [Little Lucy Ferrier]176-lucy was borne along pleasantly enough in [[Elder Stangerson]180-stangerson 's waggon]802-elder stangerson 's waggon , a retreat which [she]799-the little girl who had shared his fortunes and had been adopted as his daughter shared with [[the Mormon]181-cowper 's three wives]803-the mormon 's three wives and with [[his]175-john ferrier son]804-his son , [a headstrong forward boy of twelve]805-a headstrong forward boy of twelve . In the meantime [Ferrier]175-john ferrier having recovered from [his]175-john ferrier privations , distinguished [himself]175-john ferrier as [a useful guide]810-a useful guide and [an indefatigable hunter]811-an indefatigable hunter . So rapidly did [he]175-john ferrier gain the esteem of [[his]175-john ferrier new companions]812-his new companions , that when [they]812-his new companions reached the end of [their]812-his new companions wanderings , it was unanimously agreed that [he]175-john ferrier should be provided with as large and as fertile a tract of land as [any of [the settlers]814-the settlers]813-any of the settlers , with the exception of [Young]179-young [himself]175-john ferrier , and of [Stangerson]180-stangerson , [Kemball]182-kemball , [Johnston]183-johnston , and [Drebber]123-drebber , who were [the four principal Elders]815-the four principal elders .

On [the farm]816-the farm thus acquired [John Ferrier]175-john ferrier built [himself]175-john ferrier [a substantial log - house]817-a substantial log - house , which received so many additions in succeeding years that [it]817-a substantial log - house grew into [a roomy villa]818-a roomy villa . [He]175-john ferrier was [a man of a practical turn of mind]819-a man of a practical turn of mind , keen in [his]175-john ferrier dealings and skilful with [his]175-john ferrier hands . [His]175-john ferrier iron constitution enabled [him]175-john ferrier to work morning and evening at improving and tilling [[his]175-john ferrier lands]820-his lands . Hence it came about that [[his]175-john ferrier farm]821-his farm and all that belonged to [him]175-john ferrier prospered exceedingly . In three years [he]175-john ferrier was better off than [[his]175-john ferrier neighbours]822-his neighbours , in six [he]175-john ferrier was well - to - do , in nine [he]175-john ferrier was rich , and in twelve there were not half a dozen men in [the whole of [Salt Lake City]77-salt lake city]823-the whole of salt lake city who could compare with [him]175-john ferrier . From [the great inland sea]824-the great inland sea to [the distant Wahsatch Mountains]78-the distant wahsatch mountains there was no name better known than that of [John Ferrier]175-john ferrier .

There was one way and only one in which [he]175-john ferrier offended the susceptibilities of [[his]175-john ferrier co - religionists]825-his co - religionists . No argument or persuasion could ever induce [him]175-john ferrier to set up [a female establishment after the manner of [[his]175-john ferrier companions]742-his companions]826-a female establishment after the manner of his companions . [He]175-john ferrier never gave reasons for this persistent refusal , but contented [himself]175-john ferrier by resolutely and inflexibly adhering to [his]175-john ferrier determination . There were some who accused [him]175-john ferrier of lukewarmness in [his]175-john ferrier adopted religion , and [others who put it down to greed of wealth and reluctance to incur expense]828-others who put it down to greed of wealth and reluctance to incur expense . [Others]1744-others , again , spoke of some early love affair , and of [a fair - haired girl who had pined away on [the shores of [the Atlantic]79-the atlantic]831-the shores of the atlantic]830-a fair - haired girl who had pined away on the shores of the atlantic . Whatever the reason , [Ferrier]175-john ferrier remained strictly celibate . [Lucy Ferrier]176-lucy grew up within [the log - house]834-the log - house , and assisted [[her]830-a fair - haired girl who had pined away on the shores of the atlantic adopted father]835-her adopted father in all [his]835-her adopted father undertakings . [Many a wayfarer upon [the high road which ran by [Ferrier]175-john ferrier 's farm]841-the high road which ran by ferrier 's farm]840-many a wayfarer upon the high road which ran by ferrier 's farm felt long - forgotten thoughts revive in [their]840-many a wayfarer upon the high road which ran by ferrier 's farm mind as [they]840-many a wayfarer upon the high road which ran by ferrier 's farm watched [her]830-a fair - haired girl who had pined away on the shores of the atlantic lithe girlish figure tripping through [the wheatfields]842-the wheatfields , or met [her]830-a fair - haired girl who had pined away on the shores of the atlantic mounted upon [[[her]830-a fair - haired girl who had pined away on the shores of the atlantic father]843-her father 's mustang]844-her father 's mustang , and managing it with all the ease and grace of [a true child of [the West]651-the west]845-a true child of the west . It was not [the father]851-the father , however , who first discovered that [the child]637-the child had developed into [the woman]1551-the woman . It seldom is in such cases . That mysterious change is too subtle and too gradual to be measured by dates . Least of all does [the maiden]854-the maiden [herself]854-the maiden know it until the tone of a voice or the touch of a hand sets [her]854-the maiden heart thrilling within [her]854-the maiden , and [she]854-the maiden learns , with a mixture of pride and of fear , that a new and a larger nature has awoken within [her]854-the maiden . There are [few who can not recall that day and remember the one little incident which heralded the dawn of a new life]855-few who can not recall that day and remember the one little incident which heralded the dawn of a new life . In the case of [Lucy Ferrier]176-lucy the occasion was serious enough in itself , apart from its future influence on [her]854-the maiden destiny and that of [many besides]856-many besides .

It was a warm June morning , and the Latter Day [Saints]184-saints were as busy as the bees whose hive [they]184-saints have chosen for [their]184-saints emblem . In [the fields]857-the fields and in [the streets]858-the streets rose the same hum of [human industry]859-human industry . Down [the dusty high roads]860-the dusty high roads defiled long streams of heavily - laden mules , all heading to the west , for the gold fever had broken out in [California]80-california , and the Overland Route lay through [the City of the Elect]861-the city of the elect . There , too , were droves of sheep and bullocks coming in from [the outlying pasture lands]862-the outlying pasture lands , and trains of [tired immigrants]863-tired immigrants , [men]1701-men and horses equally weary of [their]865-their interminable journey . Through all this motley assemblage , threading [her]854-the maiden way with the skill of [an accomplished rider]866-an accomplished rider , there galloped [Lucy Ferrier]176-lucy , [her]854-the maiden fair face flushed with the exercise and [her]854-the maiden long chestnut hair floating out behind [her]854-the maiden . [She]854-the maiden had a commission from [[her]854-the maiden father]843-her father in [the City]281-the city , and was dashing in as [she]854-the maiden had done many a time before , with all the fearlessness of youth , thinking only of [her]854-the maiden task and how it was to be performed . [The travel - stained adventurers]869-the travel - stained adventurers gazed after [her]854-the maiden in astonishment , and even [the unemotional Indians]185-the unemotional indians , journeying in with [their]185-the unemotional indians pelties , relaxed [their]185-the unemotional indians accustomed stoicism as [they]185-the unemotional indians marvelled at the beauty of [the pale - faced maiden]870-the pale - faced maiden .

[She]854-the maiden had reached [the outskirts of [the city]281-the city]871-the outskirts of the city when [she]854-the maiden found [the road]1633-the road blocked by a great drove of cattle , driven by [a half - dozen wild - looking herdsmen from [the plains]875-the plains]874-a half - dozen wild - looking herdsmen from the plains . In [her]854-the maiden impatience [she]854-the maiden endeavoured to pass this obstacle by pushing [her]854-the maiden horse into what appeared to be a gap . Scarcely had [she]854-the maiden got fairly into [it]876-it , however , before the beasts closed in behind [her]854-the maiden , and [she]854-the maiden found [herself]854-the maiden completely imbedded in the moving stream of fierce - eyed , long - horned bullocks . Accustomed as [she]854-the maiden was to deal with cattle , [she]854-the maiden was not alarmed at [her]854-the maiden situation , but took advantage of every opportunity to urge [her]854-the maiden horse on in the hopes of pushing [her]854-the maiden way through the cavalcade . Unfortunately the horns of one of the creatures , either by accident or design , came in violent contact with the flank of the mustang , and excited it to madness . In an instant it reared up upon its hind legs with a snort of rage , and pranced and tossed in a way that would have unseated any but [a most skilful rider]877-a most skilful rider . The situation was full of peril . Every plunge of the excited horse brought it against the horns again , and goaded it to fresh madness . It was all that [the girl]1740-the girl could do to keep [herself]854-the maiden in the saddle , yet a slip would mean a terrible death under the hoofs of the unwieldy and terrified animals . Unaccustomed to sudden emergencies , [her]854-the maiden head began to swim , and [her]854-the maiden grip upon the bridle to relax . Choked by the rising cloud of dust and by the steam from the struggling creatures , [she]854-the maiden might have abandoned [her]854-the maiden efforts in despair , but for a kindly voice at [her]854-the maiden elbow which assured [her]854-the maiden of assistance . At the same moment a sinewy brown hand caught the frightened horse by the curb , and forcing a way through the drove , soon brought [her]854-the maiden to the outskirts .

[Young Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope rode on with [[his]187-jefferson hope companions]742-his companions , gloomy and taciturn . [He]886-the young hunter and [they]742-his companions had been among [the Nevada Mountains]83-the nevada mountains prospecting for silver , and were returning to [Salt Lake City]77-salt lake city in the hope of raising capital enough to work some lodes which [they]742-his companions had discovered . [He]886-the young hunter had been as keen as any of [them]742-his companions upon the business until this sudden incident had drawn [his]886-the young hunter thoughts into another channel . The sight of [the fair young girl , as frank and wholesome as the Sierra breezes]889-the fair young girl , as frank and wholesome as the sierra breezes , had stirred [his]886-the young hunter volcanic , untamed heart to its very depths . When [she]883-i had vanished from [his]886-the young hunter sight , [he]886-the young hunter realized that a crisis had come in [his]886-the young hunter life , and that neither silver speculations nor any other questions could ever be of such importance to [him]886-the young hunter as [this new and all - absorbing one]890-this new and all - absorbing one . The love which had sprung up in [his]886-the young hunter heart was not the sudden , changeable fancy of [a boy]891-a boy , but rather the wild , fierce passion of [a man of strong will and imperious temper]892-a man of strong will and imperious temper . [He]886-the young hunter had been accustomed to succeed in all that [he]886-the young hunter undertook . [He]886-the young hunter swore in [his]886-the young hunter heart that [he]886-the young hunter would not fail in this if human effort and human perseverance could render [him]886-the young hunter successful .

[He]886-the young hunter called on [John Ferrier]175-john ferrier that night , and many times again , until [his]175-john ferrier face was a familiar one at [the farm - house]893-the farm - house . [John]175-john ferrier , cooped up in [the valley]894-the valley , and absorbed in [his]175-john ferrier work , had had little chance of learning the news of [the outside world]895-the outside world during the last twelve years . All this [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope was able to tell [him]175-john ferrier , and in a style which interested [Lucy]176-lucy as well as [[her]896-her father]843-her father . [He]886-the young hunter had been [a pioneer in [California]80-california]898-a pioneer in california , and could narrate many a strange tale of fortunes made and fortunes lost in those wild , halcyon days . [He]886-the young hunter had been [a scout]899-a scout too , and [a trapper]900-a trapper , [a silver explorer]901-a silver explorer , and [a ranchman]902-a ranchman . Wherever stirring adventures were to be had , [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope had been there in search of [them]903-them . [He]886-the young hunter soon became a favourite with [the old farmer]904-the old farmer , who spoke eloquently of [his]886-the young hunter virtues . On such occasions , [Lucy]176-lucy was silent , but [her]896-her blushing cheek and [her]896-her bright , happy eyes , showed only too clearly that [her]896-her young heart was no longer [her]896-her own . [[Her]896-her honest father]905-her honest father may not have observed these symptoms , but they were assuredly not thrown away upon [the man who had won [her]896-her affections]906-the man who had won her affections .

It was a summer evening when [he]886-the young hunter came galloping down [the road]1633-the road and pulled up at the gate . [She]896-her was at the doorway , and came down to meet [him]886-the young hunter . [He]886-the young hunter threw the bridle over the fence and strode up [the pathway]369-the pathway .

" Oh , well ; of course , if [you]909-he and [father]1939-father have arranged it all , there 's no more to be said , "[909-he] [she]896-her whispered , with [her]896-her cheek against [his]909-he broad breast .

" Thank [God]159-god ! "[909-he] [he]909-he said , hoarsely , stooping and kissing [her]896-her . " It is settled , then . The longer [I]175-john ferrier stay , the harder it will be to go . [They]1946-they are waiting for [me]175-john ferrier at [the caon]1947-the caon . Good - bye , [[my]175-john ferrier own darling]1948-my own darling - good - bye . In two months [you]896-her shall see [me]175-john ferrier . "[175-john ferrier]

[He]909-he tore [himself]909-he from [her]896-her as [he]909-he spoke , and , flinging [himself]909-he upon [his]909-he horse , galloped furiously away , never even looking round , as though afraid that [his]909-he resolution might fail [him]909-he if [he]909-he took one glance at what [he]909-he was leaving . [She]896-her stood at the gate , gazing after [him]909-he until [he]909-he vanished from [her]896-her sight . Then [she]896-her walked back into [the house]1453-the house , [the happiest girl in all [Utah]76-utah]911-the happiest girl in all utah .

Three weeks had passed since [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope and [[his]187-jefferson hope comrades]912-his comrades had departed from [Salt Lake City]77-salt lake city . [John Ferrier]175-john ferrier 's heart was sore within [him]175-john ferrier when [he]175-john ferrier thought of [the young man]1781-the young man 's return , and of the impending loss of [[his]175-john ferrier adopted child]914-his adopted child . Yet [her]896-her bright and happy face reconciled [him]175-john ferrier to the arrangement more than any argument could have done . [He]175-john ferrier had always determined , deep down in [his]175-john ferrier resolute heart , that nothing would ever induce [him]175-john ferrier to allow [[his]175-john ferrier daughter]800-his daughter to [we]916-we d [a Mormon]917-a mormon . Such a marriage [he]175-john ferrier regarded as no marriage at all , but as a shame and a disgrace . Whatever [he]175-john ferrier might think of the Mormon doctrines , upon that one point [he]175-john ferrier was inflexible . [He]175-john ferrier had to seal [his]175-john ferrier mouth on the subject , however , for to express an unorthodox opinion was a dangerous matter in those days in [the Land of]918-the land of [the Saints]184-saints .

Yes , a dangerous matter - so dangerous that [even the most saintly]919-even the most saintly dared only whisper [their]919-even the most saintly religious opinions with bated breath , lest something which fell from [their]919-even the most saintly lips might be misconstrued , and bring down a swift retribution upon [them]919-even the most saintly . [The victims of persecution]920-the victims of persecution had now turned [persecutors]921-persecutors on [their]920-the victims of persecution own account , and [persecutors of the most terrible description]922-persecutors of the most terrible description . Not [the Inquisition of [Seville]84-seville]923-the inquisition of seville , nor the German Vehmgericht , nor [the Secret Societies of [Italy]85-italy]924-the secret societies of italy , were ever able to put a more formidable machinery in motion than that which cast a cloud over [the State of [Utah]76-utah]925-the state of utah .

Its invisibility , and the mystery which was attached to it , made this organization doubly terrible . [It]926-it appeared to be omniscient and omnipotent , and yet was neither seen nor heard . [The man who held out against the Church]927-the man who held out against the church vanished away , and [none]928-none knew whither [he]927-the man who held out against the church had gone or what had befallen [him]927-the man who held out against the church . [[His]927-the man who held out against the church wife]929-his wife and [[his]927-the man who held out against the church children]930-his children awaited [him]927-the man who held out against the church at [home]1598-home , but [no father]932-no father ever returned to tell [them]933-them how [he]927-the man who held out against the church had fared at the hands of [[his]927-the man who held out against the church secret judges]934-his secret judges . A rash word or a hasty act was followed by annihilation , and yet [none]928-none knew what the nature might be of this terrible power which was suspended over [them]933-them . No wonder that [men]1701-men went about in fear and trembling , and that even in [the heart of [the wilderness]605-the wilderness]937-the heart of the wilderness [they]1701-men dared not whisper the doubts which oppressed [them]1701-men .

At first this vague and terrible power was exercised only upon [the recalcitrants who , having embraced the Mormon faith]939-the recalcitrants who , having embraced the mormon faith , wished afterwards to pervert or to abandon it . Soon , however , it took a wider range . The supply of [adult women]940-adult women was running short , and polygamy without [a female population on which to draw]941-a female population on which to draw was a barren doctrine indeed . Strange rumours began to be bandied about - rumours of [murdered immigrants]942-murdered immigrants and [rifled camps]943-rifled camps in [regions where [Indians]185-the unemotional indians had never been seen]944-regions where indians had never been seen . [Fresh women]945-fresh women appeared in [the harems of [the Elders]947-the elders]946-the harems of the elders - [women who pined and wept]948-women who pined and wept , and bore upon [their]948-women who pined and wept faces the traces of an unextinguishable horror . [Belated wanderers upon [the mountains]680-the mountains]949-belated wanderers upon the mountains spoke of [gangs of armed men]951-gangs of armed men , masked , stealthy , and noiseless , who flitted by [them]951-gangs of armed men in the darkness . These tales and rumours took substance and shape , and were corroborated and re - corroborated , until they resolved themselves into a definite name . To this day , in [the lonely ranches of [the West]86-the west]952-the lonely ranches of the west , the name of [the Danite Band]953-the danite band , or [the Avenging Angels]188-the avenging angels , is [a sinister and an ill - omened one]954-a sinister and an ill - omened one .

Fuller knowledge of the organization which produced such terrible results served to increase rather than to lessen the horror which it inspired in the minds of [men]1701-men . [None]928-none knew who belonged to [this ruthless society]957-this ruthless society . The names of [the participators in the deeds of blood and violence done under the name of religion]958-the participators in the deeds of blood and violence done under the name of religion were kept profoundly secret . [The very friend to whom [you]960-you communicated [your]960-you misgivings as to [the Prophet]961-the prophet and [his]961-the prophet mission]959-the very friend to whom you communicated your misgivings as to the prophet and his mission , might be one of [those who would come forth at night with fire and sword to exact a terrible reparation]962-those who would come forth at night with fire and sword to exact a terrible reparation . Hence [every man]963-every man feared [[his]963-every man neighbour]964-his neighbour , and [none]928-none spoke of the things which were nearest [his]963-every man heart .

One fine morning , [John Ferrier]175-john ferrier was about to set out to [[his]175-john ferrier wheatfields]966-his wheatfields , when [he]175-john ferrier heard the click of the latch , and , looking through the window , saw [a stout , sandy - haired , middle - aged man]967-a stout , sandy - haired , middle - aged man coming up [the pathway]369-the pathway . [His]175-john ferrier heart leapt to [his]175-john ferrier mouth , for this was none other than [the great Brigham Young [himself]969-the great brigham young himself]969-the great brigham young himself . Full of trepidation - for [he]175-john ferrier knew that such a visit boded [him]175-john ferrier little good - [Ferrier]175-john ferrier ran to the door to greet [the Mormon chief]970-the mormon chief . [The latter]1782-the latter , however , received [his]175-john ferrier salutations coldly , and followed [him]175-john ferrier with a stern face into [the sitting - room]282-the sitting - room .

" [Brother Ferrier]189-brother ferrier , "[175-john ferrier] [he]175-john ferrier said , taking a seat , and eyeing [the farmer]973-the farmer keenly from under [his]175-john ferrier light - coloured eyelashes , " [the true believers]1949-the true believers have been [good friends]1950-good friends to [you]189-brother ferrier . Is not this so ? "[175-john ferrier]

" It is so , "[175-john ferrier] answered [John Ferrier]175-john ferrier .

" In return for all this [we]1949-the true believers asked but one condition : that was , that [you]189-brother ferrier should embrace the true faith , and conform in every way to its usages . " There are two ways out of [the room]259-the room , "[175-john ferrier] cried [Ferrier]175-john ferrier ; " there is the door , and there is the window . Which do [you]999-his two visitors care to use ? "[904-the old farmer]

" [The young canting rascals]2029-the young canting rascals ! "[1006-i]

" And so should [I]1006-i , [father]1939-father , "[1006-i] [she]1006-i answered , with spirit ; " but [Jefferson]187-jefferson hope will soon be here . "[175-john ferrier]

" Yes . It will not be long before [he]187-jefferson hope comes . The sooner the better , for [we]2035-we do not know what [their]2033-them next move may be . "[175-john ferrier]

It was , indeed , high time that [someone capable of giving advice and help]1008-someone capable of giving advice and help should come to the aid of [the sturdy old farmer]1009-the sturdy old farmer and [[his]1009-the sturdy old farmer adopted daughter]1010-his adopted daughter . In the whole history of [the settlement]1011-the settlement there had never been such a case of rank disobedience to the authority of [the Elders]947-the elders . If minor errors were punished so sternly , what would be the fate of [this arch rebel]1013-this arch rebel . [Ferrier]175-john ferrier knew that [his]175-john ferrier wealth and position would be of no avail to [him]175-john ferrier . [Others as well known and as rich as [himself]175-john ferrier]1014-others as well known and as rich as himself had been spirited away before now , and [their]1014-others as well known and as rich as himself goods given over to [the Church]2021-the church . [He]175-john ferrier was [a brave man]1016-a brave man , but [he]175-john ferrier trembled at the vague , shadowy terrors which hung over [him]175-john ferrier . Any known danger [he]175-john ferrier could face with a firm lip , but this suspense was unnerving . [He]175-john ferrier concealed [his]175-john ferrier fears from [[his]175-john ferrier daughter]800-his daughter , however , and affected to make light of the whole matter , though [she]800-his daughter , with the keen eye of love , saw plainly that [he]175-john ferrier was ill at ease .

[He]175-john ferrier expected that [he]175-john ferrier would receive some message or remonstrance from [Young]187-jefferson hope as to [his]175-john ferrier conduct , and [he]175-john ferrier was not mistaken , though it came in an unlooked - for manner . Upon rising next morning [he]175-john ferrier found , to [his]175-john ferrier surprise , a small square of paper pinned on to the coverlet of [his]175-john ferrier bed just over [his]175-john ferrier chest . On it was printed , in bold straggling letters : -

" Twenty - nine days are given [you]175-john ferrier for amendment , and then - - "[175-john ferrier]

The dash was more fear - inspiring than any threat could have been . How this warning came into [[his]175-john ferrier room]479-his room puzzled [John Ferrier]175-john ferrier sorely , for [[his]175-john ferrier servants]1019-his servants slept in [an outhouse]1020-an outhouse , and the doors and windows had all been secured . [He]175-john ferrier crumpled the paper up and said nothing to [[his]175-john ferrier daughter]800-his daughter , but the incident struck a chill into [his]175-john ferrier heart . The twenty - nine days were evidently the balance of the month which [Young]187-jefferson hope had promised . What strength or courage could avail against [an enemy armed with such mysterious powers]1022-an enemy armed with such mysterious powers ? The hand which fastened that pin might have struck [him]175-john ferrier to the heart , and [he]175-john ferrier could never have known who had slain [him]175-john ferrier .

Still more shaken was [he]175-john ferrier next morning . [They]1023-they had sat down to [their]1023-they breakfast when [Lucy]176-lucy with a cry of surprise pointed upwards . In the centre of the ceiling was scrawled , with a burned stick apparently , the number 28 . To [[his]175-john ferrier daughter]800-his daughter it was unintelligible , and [he]175-john ferrier did not enlighten [her]800-his daughter . That night [he]175-john ferrier sat up with [his]175-john ferrier gun and kept watch and ward . [He]175-john ferrier saw and [he]175-john ferrier heard nothing , and yet in the morning a great 27 had been painted upon the outside of [his]175-john ferrier door .

Thus day followed day ; and as sure as morning came [he]175-john ferrier found that [[his]175-john ferrier unseen enemies]1025-his unseen enemies had kept [their]1025-his unseen enemies register , and had marked up in some conspicuous position how many days were still left to [him]175-john ferrier out of the month of grace . Sometimes the fatal numbers appeared upon the walls , sometimes upon the floors , occasionally they were on small placards stuck upon the garden gate or the railings . With all [his]175-john ferrier vigilance [John Ferrier]175-john ferrier could not discover whence these daily warnings proceeded . A horror which was almost superstitious came upon [him]175-john ferrier at the sight of [them]1026-them . [He]175-john ferrier became haggard and restless , and [his]175-john ferrier eyes had the troubled look of some hunted creature . [He]175-john ferrier had but one hope in life now , and that was for the arrival of [the young hunter]886-the young hunter from [Nevada]87-nevada .

Twenty had changed to fifteen and fifteen to ten , but there was no news of [the absentee]1028-the absentee . One by one the numbers dwindled down , and still there came no sign of [him]175-john ferrier . Whenever [a horseman]1029-a horseman clattered down [the road]1633-the road , or [a driver]1031-a driver shouted at [[his]175-john ferrier team]1032-his team , [the old farmer]904-the old farmer hurried to the gate thinking that help had arrived at last . At last , when [he]175-john ferrier saw five give way to four and that again to three , [he]175-john ferrier lost heart , and abandoned all hope of escape . Single - handed , and with [his]175-john ferrier limited knowledge of [the mountains which surrounded [the settlement]1011-the settlement]1034-the mountains which surrounded the settlement , [he]175-john ferrier knew that [he]175-john ferrier was powerless . [The more - frequented roads]1036-the more - frequented roads were strictly watched and guarded , and none could pass along [them]1036-the more - frequented roads without an order from [the Council]1037-the council . Turn which way [he]175-john ferrier would , there appeared to be no avoiding the blow which hung over [him]175-john ferrier . Yet [the old man]1038-the old man never wavered in [his]1038-the old man resolution to part with life itself before [he]1038-the old man consented to what [he]1038-the old man regarded as [[his]1038-the old man daughter]800-his daughter 's dishonour .

[He]175-john ferrier was sitting alone one evening pondering deeply over [his]175-john ferrier troubles , and searching vainly for some way out of [them]1040-them . That morning had shown the figure 2 upon the wall of [[his]175-john ferrier house]1931-his house , and the next day would be the last of the allotted time . What was to happen then ? All manner of vague and terrible fancies filled [his]175-john ferrier imagination . And [[his]175-john ferrier daughter]800-his daughter - what was to become of [her]800-his daughter after [he]175-john ferrier was gone ? Was there no escape from the invisible network which was drawn all round [them]1043-them . [He]175-john ferrier sank [his]175-john ferrier head upon the table and sobbed at the thought of [his]175-john ferrier own impotence .

What was that ? In the silence [he]175-john ferrier heard a gentle scratching sound - low , but very distinct in the quiet of the night . It came from the door of [the house]1453-the house . [Ferrier]175-john ferrier crept into [the hall]396-the hall and listened intently . There was a pause for a few moments , and then the low insidious sound was repeated . [Someone]1321-someone was evidently tapping very gently upon one of the panels of the door . Was it [some midnight assassin who had come to carry out the murderous orders of [the secret tribunal]1048-the secret tribunal]1047-some midnight assassin who had come to carry out the murderous orders of the secret tribunal ? Or was it [some agent who was marking up that the last day of grace]1049-some agent who was marking up that the last day of grace had arrived . [John Ferrier]175-john ferrier felt that instant death would be better than the suspense which shook [his]175-john ferrier nerves and chilled [his]175-john ferrier heart . Springing forward [he]175-john ferrier drew the bolt and threw the door open .

Outside all was calm and quiet . The night was fine , and the stars were twinkling brightly overhead . [The little front garden]1050-the little front garden lay before [the farmer]973-the farmer 's eyes bounded by the fence and gate , but neither there nor on [the road]1633-the road was [any human being to be seen]1053-any human being to be seen . With a sigh of relief , [Ferrier]175-john ferrier looked to right and to left , until happening to glance straight down at [his]175-john ferrier own feet [he]175-john ferrier saw to [his]175-john ferrier astonishment [a man]226-a man lying flat upon [his]226-a man face upon the ground , with arms and legs all asprawl .

So unnerved was [he]175-john ferrier at the sight that [he]175-john ferrier leaned up against the wall with [his]175-john ferrier hand to [his]175-john ferrier throat to stifle [his]175-john ferrier inclination to call out . [His]175-john ferrier first thought was that [the prostrate figure]1055-the prostrate figure was that of [some wounded or dying man]1056-some wounded or dying man , but as [he]175-john ferrier watched it [he]175-john ferrier saw it writhe along the ground and into [the hall]396-the hall with the rapidity and noiselessness of a serpent . Once within [the house]1453-the house [the man]1387-the man sprang to [his]1387-the man feet , closed the door , and revealed to [the astonished farmer]1060-the astonished farmer the fierce face and resolute expression of [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope .

" [Good God]159-god ! "[175-john ferrier] gasped [John Ferrier]175-john ferrier . " How [you]569-the other scared [me]569-the other ! Whatever made [you]569-the other come in like that . "[569-the other]

" Give [me]569-the other food , "[569-the other] [the other]569-the other said , hoarsely . " [I]175-john ferrier have had no time for bite or sup for eight - and - forty hours . "[175-john ferrier] [He]175-john ferrier flung [himself]175-john ferrier upon the cold meat and bread which were still lying upon the table from [[his]175-john ferrier host]1062-his host 's supper , and devoured it voraciously . " Does [Lucy]176-lucy bear up well ? "[843-her father] [he]175-john ferrier asked , when [he]175-john ferrier had satisfied [his]175-john ferrier hunger .

" Yes . [She]1063-she does not know the danger , "[175-john ferrier] [[her]1063-she father]843-her father answered .

" That is well . [The house]1453-the house is watched on every side . That is why [I]175-john ferrier crawled [my]175-john ferrier way up to [it]1453-the house . While [Ferrier]176-lucy was absent , preparing [[his]176-lucy daughter]800-his daughter for the approaching journey , [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope packed all the eatables that [he]187-jefferson hope could find into a small parcel , and filled a stoneware jar with water , for [he]187-jefferson hope knew by experience that [the mountain wells]1070-the mountain wells were few and far between . [He]187-jefferson hope had hardly completed [his]187-jefferson hope arrangements before [the farmer]973-the farmer returned with [[his]176-lucy daughter]800-his daughter all dressed and ready for a start . " [We]1073-the lovers must make [our]1073-the lovers start at once , "[187-jefferson hope] said [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope , speaking in a low but resolute voice , like [one who realizes the greatness of the peril]1074-one who realizes the greatness of the peril , but has steeled [his]1074-one who realizes the greatness of the peril heart to meet it . " The front and back entrances are watched , but with caution [we]1073-the lovers may get away through the side window and across [the fields]857-the fields . " What if [we]1073-the lovers are stopped , "[187-jefferson hope] asked [Ferrier]176-lucy .

[Hope]187-jefferson hope slapped the revolver butt which protruded from the front of [his]187-jefferson hope tunic . The lights inside [the house]1453-the house had all been extinguished , and from the darkened window [Ferrier]176-lucy peered over [the fields]857-the fields which had been [his]176-lucy own , and which [he]176-lucy was now about to abandon for ever . [He]176-lucy had long nerved [himself]176-lucy to the sacrifice , however , and the thought of the honour and happiness of [[his]176-lucy daughter]800-his daughter outweighed any regret at [his]176-lucy ruined fortunes . All looked so peaceful and happy , the rustling trees and [the broad silent stretch of grain - land]1078-the broad silent stretch of grain - land , that it was difficult to realize that the spirit of murder lurked through it all . Yet the white face and set expression of [the young hunter]886-the young hunter showed that in [his]176-lucy approach to [the house]1453-the house [he]176-lucy had seen enough to satisfy [him]176-lucy upon that head .

[Ferrier]176-lucy carried the bag of gold and notes , [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope had the scanty provisions and water , while [Lucy]176-lucy had a small bundle containing a few of [her]1081-her more valued possessions . Opening the window very slowly and carefully , [they]1082-they waited until a dark cloud had somewhat obscured the night , and then one by one passed through into [the little garden]1083-the little garden . With bated breath and crouching figures [they]1082-they stumbled across [it]1083-the little garden , and gained the shelter of the hedge , which [they]1082-they skirted until [they]1082-they came to the gap which opened into [the cornfields]1084-the cornfields . [They]1082-they had just reached this point when [the young man]1781-the young man seized [[his]1781-the young man two companions]1086-his two companions and dragged [them]1086-his two companions down into the shadow , where [they]1086-his two companions lay silent and trembling .

It was as well that [his]1781-the young man prairie training had given [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope the ears of a lynx . [He]1781-the young man and [[his]1781-the young man friends]1418-his friends had hardly crouched down before the melancholy hooting of a mountain owl was heard within a few yards of [them]1082-they , which was immediately answered by another hoot at a small distance . At the same moment [a vague shadowy figure]1088-a vague shadowy figure emerged from the gap for which [they]1082-they had been making , and uttered the plaintive signal cry again , on which [a second man]1089-a second man appeared out of the obscurity .

" To - morrow at midnight , "[1090-the first who appeared to be in authority] said [the first who appeared to be in authority]1090-the first who appeared to be in authority . " When [the Whip - poor - Will]193-the whip - poor - will calls three times . "[569-the other]

[Their]1082-they concluding words had evidently been some form of sign and countersign .
