" Hurry on ! hurry on ! "[187-jefferson hope] [he]187-jefferson hope gasped from time to time . " [We]1082-they are through the line of [sentinels]2052-sentinels . Everything depends on speed . Hurry on ! "[187-jefferson hope]

Once on [the high road]1097-the high road [they]1082-they made rapid progress . Only once did [they]1082-they meet [anyone]1332-anyone , and then [they]1082-they managed to slip into [a field]1099-a field , and so avoid recognition . Before reaching [the town]788-the town [the hunter]1101-the hunter branched away into [a rugged and narrow footpath which led to [the mountains]680-the mountains]1102-a rugged and narrow footpath which led to the mountains . [Two dark jagged peaks]1104-two dark jagged peaks loomed above [them]1082-they through the darkness , and the defile which led between [them]1082-they was [the Eagle Caon in which the horses were awaiting [them]1082-they]1105-the eagle caon in which the horses were awaiting them . With unerring instinct [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope picked [his]187-jefferson hope way among [the great boulders]1106-the great boulders and along the bed of [a dried - up watercourse]1107-a dried - up watercourse , until [he]187-jefferson hope came to the retired corner , screened with rocks , where the faithful animals had been picketed . [The girl]1740-the girl was placed upon the mule , and old [Ferrier]176-lucy upon one of the horses , with [his]176-lucy money - bag , while [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope led the other along the precipitous and dangerous path .

It was a bewildering route for [anyone who was not accustomed to face Nature in [her]1109-anyone who was not accustomed to face nature in her wildest moods wildest moods]1109-anyone who was not accustomed to face nature in her wildest moods . On the one side a great crag towered up a thousand feet or more , black , stern , and menacing , with long basaltic columns upon [its]1110-its rugged surface like the ribs of some petrified monster . On the other hand a wild chaos of boulders and debris made all advance impossible . Between the two ran the irregular track , so narrow in places that [they]1082-they had to travel in Indian file , and so rough that only [practised riders]1111-practised riders could have traversed [it]1112-it at all . Yet in spite of all dangers and difficulties , the hearts of [the fugitives]1113-the fugitives were light within [them]1082-they , for every step increased the distance between [them]1082-they and the terrible despotism from which [they]1082-they were flying .

[They]1082-they soon had a proof , however , that [they]1082-they were still within the jurisdiction of [the Saints]586-the saints . [They]1082-they had reached [the very wildest and most desolate portion of the pass]1115-the very wildest and most desolate portion of the pass when [the girl]1740-the girl gave a startled cry , and pointed upwards . On a rock which overlooked [the track]1117-the track , showing out dark and plain against the sky , there stood [a solitary sentinel]1118-a solitary sentinel . [He]187-jefferson hope saw [them]1082-they as soon as [they]1082-they perceived [him]187-jefferson hope , and [his]187-jefferson hope military challenge of " Who goes there ? "[187-jefferson hope] rang through [the silent ravine]1119-the silent ravine .

" Travellers for [Nevada]87-nevada , "[187-jefferson hope] said [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope , with [his]187-jefferson hope hand upon the rifle which hung by [his]187-jefferson hope saddle .

[They]1082-they could see [the lonely watcher]1120-the lonely watcher fingering [his]1120-the lonely watcher gun , and peering down at [them]1082-they as if dissatisfied at [their]1082-they reply .

" By whose permission ? "[176-lucy] [he]187-jefferson hope asked .

" [The Holy Four]190-the holy four , "[1121-the sentinel] answered [Ferrier]176-lucy . [His]176-lucy Mormon experiences had taught [him]176-lucy that that was the highest authority to which [he]176-lucy could refer .

" Nine from seven , "[187-jefferson hope] cried [the sentinel]1121-the sentinel .

" Seven from five , "[1120-the lonely watcher] returned [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope promptly , remembering the countersign which [he]187-jefferson hope had heard in [the garden]354-the garden .

" Pass , and [the Lord]1649-the lord go with [you]2054-you , "[187-jefferson hope] said the voice from above . Beyond [his]1120-the lonely watcher post the path broadened out , and the horses were able to break into a trot . Looking back , [they]1082-they could see [the solitary watcher]1123-the solitary watcher leaning upon [his]1120-the lonely watcher gun , and knew that [they]1082-they had passed [the outlying post of [the chosen people]1125-the chosen people]1124-the outlying post of the chosen people , and that freedom lay before [them]1082-they .

All night [their]1082-they course lay through intricate defiles and over irregular and rock - strewn paths . More than once [they]1082-they lost [their]1082-they way , but [Hope]187-jefferson hope 's intimate knowledge of [the mountains]680-the mountains enabled [them]1082-they to regain [the track]1117-the track once more . When morning broke , a scene of marvellous though savage beauty lay before [them]1082-they . In every direction the great snow - capped peaks hemmed [them]1082-they in , peeping over each other 's shoulders to the far horizon . So steep were [the rocky banks on either side of [them]1082-they]1128-the rocky banks on either side of them , that the larch and the pine seemed to be suspended over [their]1082-they heads , and to need only a gust of wind to come hurtling down upon [them]1082-they . Nor was the fear entirely an illusion , for [the barren valley]1129-the barren valley was thickly strewn with trees and boulders which had fallen in a similar manner . Even as [they]1082-they passed , a great rock came thundering down with a hoarse rattle which woke the echoes in [the silent gorges]1130-the silent gorges , and startled the weary horses into a gallop .

As the sun rose slowly above the eastern horizon , [the caps of [the great mountains]1903-the great mountains]1131-the caps of the great mountains lit up one after the other , like lamps at a festival , until they were all ruddy and glowing . The magnificent spectacle cheered the hearts of [the three fugitives]1133-the three fugitives and gave [them]1133-the three fugitives fresh energy . At a wild torrent which swept out of [a ravine]1134-a ravine [they]1082-they called a halt and watered [their]1082-they horses , while [they]1082-they partook of a hasty breakfast . [Lucy]176-lucy and [[her]1135-her father]843-her father would fain have rested longer , but [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope was inexorable . " [They]1133-the three fugitives will be upon [our]1082-they track by this time , "[187-jefferson hope] [he]187-jefferson hope said . " Everything depends upon [our]1082-they speed . Once safe in [Carson]91-carson [we]1082-they may rest for the remainder of [our]1082-they lives . "[187-jefferson hope]

During the whole of that day [they]1082-they struggled on through [the defiles]1137-the defiles , and by evening [they]1082-they calculated that [they]1082-they were more than thirty miles from [[their]1082-they enemies]1138-their enemies . At night - time [they]1082-they chose the base of a beetling crag , where the rocks offered some protection from the chill wind , and there huddled together for warmth , [they]1082-they enjoyed a few hours ' sleep . Before daybreak , however , [they]1082-they were up and on [their]1082-they way once more . [They]1082-they had seen no signs of [any pursuers]1139-any pursuers , and [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope began to think that [they]1082-they were fairly out of the reach of the terrible organization whose enmity [they]1082-they had incurred . [He]187-jefferson hope little knew how far that iron grasp could reach , or how soon it was to close upon [them]1082-they and crush [them]1082-they .

About the middle of the second day of [their]1082-they flight [their]1082-they scanty store of provisions began to run out . This gave [the hunter]1101-the hunter little uneasiness , however , for there was game to be had among [the mountains]680-the mountains , and [he]187-jefferson hope had frequently before had to depend upon [his]187-jefferson hope rifle for the needs of life . Choosing [a sheltered nook]1142-a sheltered nook , [he]187-jefferson hope piled together a few dried branches and made a blazing fire , at which [[his]187-jefferson hope companions]742-his companions might warm [themselves]742-his companions , for [they]742-his companions were now nearly five thousand feet above the sea level , and the air was bitter and keen . Having tethered the horses , and bade [Lucy]176-lucy adieu , [he]187-jefferson hope threw [his]187-jefferson hope gun over [his]187-jefferson hope shoulder , and set out in search of whatever chance might throw in [his]187-jefferson hope way . Looking back [he]187-jefferson hope saw [the old man]1038-the old man and [the young girl]839-the young girl crouching over the blazing fire , while the three animals stood motionless in the back - ground . Then the intervening rocks hid [them]1082-they from [his]187-jefferson hope view .

[He]187-jefferson hope walked for a couple of miles through [one ravine]1146-one ravine after another without success , though from the marks upon the bark of the trees , and other indications , [he]187-jefferson hope judged that there were numerous bears in [the vicinity]1800-the vicinity . At last , after two or three hours ' fruitless search , [he]187-jefferson hope was thinking of turning back in despair , when casting [his]187-jefferson hope eyes upwards [he]187-jefferson hope saw a sight which sent a thrill of pleasure through [his]187-jefferson hope heart . On the edge of a jutting pinnacle , three or four hundred feet above [him]187-jefferson hope , there stood [a creature somewhat resembling a sheep in appearance , but armed with a pair of gigantic horns]1148-a creature somewhat resembling a sheep in appearance , but armed with a pair of gigantic horns . The big - horn - for so it is called - was acting , probably , as a guardian over a flock which were invisible to [the hunter]1101-the hunter ; but fortunately it was heading in the opposite direction , and had not perceived [him]187-jefferson hope . Lying on [his]187-jefferson hope face , [he]187-jefferson hope rested [his]187-jefferson hope rifle upon a rock , and took a long and steady aim before drawing the trigger . The animal sprang into the air , tottered for a moment upon the edge of the precipice , and then came crashing down into [the valley beneath]1150-the valley beneath .

The creature was too unwieldy to lift , so [the hunter]1101-the hunter contented [himself]187-jefferson hope with cutting away one haunch and part of the flank . With this trophy over [his]187-jefferson hope shoulder , [he]187-jefferson hope hastened to retrace [his]187-jefferson hope steps , for the evening was already drawing in . [He]187-jefferson hope had hardly started , however , before [he]187-jefferson hope realized the difficulty which faced [him]187-jefferson hope . In [his]187-jefferson hope eagerness [he]187-jefferson hope had wandered far past [the ravines]1152-the ravines which were known to [him]187-jefferson hope , and it was no easy matter to pick out the path which [he]187-jefferson hope had taken . [The valley in which [he]187-jefferson hope found [himself]187-jefferson hope]1153-the valley in which he found himself divided and sub - divided into many gorges , which were so like each other that it was impossible to distinguish one from the other . [He]187-jefferson hope followed one for a mile or more until [he]187-jefferson hope came to [a mountain torrent]1154-a mountain torrent which [he]187-jefferson hope was sure that [he]187-jefferson hope had never seen before . Convinced that [he]187-jefferson hope had taken the wrong turn , [he]187-jefferson hope tried another , but with the same result . Night was coming on rapidly , and it was almost dark before [he]187-jefferson hope at last found [himself]187-jefferson hope in a defile which was familiar to [him]187-jefferson hope . Even then it was no easy matter to keep to the right track , for the moon had not yet risen , and the high cliffs on either side made the obscurity more profound . Weighed down with [his]187-jefferson hope burden , and weary from [his]187-jefferson hope exertions , [he]187-jefferson hope stumbled along , keeping up [his]187-jefferson hope heart by the reflection that every step brought [him]187-jefferson hope nearer to [Lucy]176-lucy , and that [he]187-jefferson hope carried with [him]187-jefferson hope enough to ensure [them]1155-them food for the remainder of [their]1155-them journey .

[He]187-jefferson hope had now come to the mouth of [the very defile in which [he]187-jefferson hope had left [them]1155-them]1156-the very defile in which he had left them . Even in the darkness [he]187-jefferson hope could recognize the outline of [the cliffs which bounded [it]1156-the very defile in which he had left them]1157-the cliffs which bounded it . [They]1155-them must , [he]187-jefferson hope reflected , be awaiting [him]187-jefferson hope anxiously , for [he]187-jefferson hope had been absent nearly five hours . In the gladness of [his]187-jefferson hope heart [he]187-jefferson hope put [his]187-jefferson hope hands to [his]187-jefferson hope mouth and made the glen re - echo to a loud halloo as a signal that [he]187-jefferson hope was coming . [He]187-jefferson hope paused and listened for an answer . None came save [his]187-jefferson hope own cry , which clattered up [the dreary silent ravines]1158-the dreary silent ravines , and was borne back to [his]187-jefferson hope ears in countless repetitions . Again [he]187-jefferson hope shouted , even louder than before , and again no whisper came back from [the friends whom [he]187-jefferson hope had left such a short time ago]1159-the friends whom he had left such a short time ago . A vague , nameless dread came over [him]187-jefferson hope , and [he]187-jefferson hope hurried onwards frantically , dropping the precious food in [his]187-jefferson hope agitation .

When [he]187-jefferson hope turned the corner , [he]187-jefferson hope came full in sight of the spot where the fire had been lit . There was still a glowing pile of wood ashes there , but it had evidently not been tended since [his]187-jefferson hope departure . The same dead silence still reigned all round . With [his]187-jefferson hope fears all changed to convictions , [he]187-jefferson hope hurried on . There was [no living creature near the remains of the fire]1160-no living creature near the remains of the fire : animals , [man]1348-man , [maiden]1162-maiden , all were gone . It was only too clear that some sudden and terrible disaster had occurred during [his]187-jefferson hope absence - a disaster which had embraced [them]1163-them all , and yet had left no traces behind it .

Bewildered and stunned by this blow , [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope felt [his]187-jefferson hope head spin round , and had to lean upon [his]187-jefferson hope rifle to save [himself]187-jefferson hope from falling . [He]187-jefferson hope was essentially [a man of action]1164-a man of action , however , and speedily recovered from [his]187-jefferson hope temporary impotence . Seizing a half - consumed piece of wood from the smouldering fire , [he]187-jefferson hope blew it into a flame , and proceeded with its help to examine [the little camp]1165-the little camp . The ground was all stamped down by the feet of horses , showing that [a large party of [mounted men]1167-mounted men]1166-a large party of mounted men had overtaken [the fugitives]1113-the fugitives , and the direction of [their]1166-a large party of mounted men tracks proved that [they]1166-a large party of mounted men had afterwards turned back to [Salt Lake City]77-salt lake city . Had [they]1166-a large party of mounted men carried back [both of [[his]187-jefferson hope companions]742-his companions]1169-both of his companions with [them]1166-a large party of mounted men ? [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope had almost persuaded [himself]187-jefferson hope that [they]1166-a large party of mounted men must have done so , when [his]187-jefferson hope eye fell upon an object which made every nerve of [his]187-jefferson hope body tingle within [him]187-jefferson hope . A little way on one side of [the camp]1171-the camp was a low - lying heap of reddish soil , which had assuredly not been there before . There was no mistaking [it]1172-it for anything but [a newly - dug grave]1173-a newly - dug grave . As [the young hunter]886-the young hunter approached [it]1172-it , [he]886-the young hunter perceived that a stick had been planted on it , with a sheet of paper stuck in the cleft fork of it . The inscription upon the paper was brief , but to the point :

[JOHN FERRIER]175-john ferrier , FORMERLY OF [SALT LAKE CITY]77-salt lake city , Died August 4th , 1860 .

[The sturdy old man , whom [he]1175-the sturdy old man , whom he had left so short a time before had left so short a time before]1175-the sturdy old man , whom he had left so short a time before , was gone , then , and this was all [his]1175-the sturdy old man , whom he had left so short a time before epitaph . [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope looked wildly round to see if there was [a second grave]1176-a second grave , but there was no sign of one . [Lucy]176-lucy had been carried back by [[their]1166-a large party of mounted men terrible pursuers]1177-their terrible pursuers to fulfil [her]1178-her original destiny , by becoming [one of the harem of [[the Elder]706-the elder 's son]1181-the elder 's son]1179-one of the harem of the elder 's son . As [the young fellow]884-the young fellow realized the certainty of [her]1178-her fate , and [his]884-the young fellow own powerlessness to prevent it , [he]884-the young fellow wished that [he]884-the young fellow , too , was lying with [the old farmer]904-the old farmer in [his]884-the young fellow last silent resting - place .

Again , however , [his]884-the young fellow active spirit shook off the lethargy which springs from despair . If there was nothing else left to [him]884-the young fellow , [he]884-the young fellow could at least devote [his]884-the young fellow life to revenge . With indomitable patience and perseverance , [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope possessed also a power of sustained vindictiveness , which [he]187-jefferson hope may have learned from [the Indians amongst whom [he]187-jefferson hope had lived]1184-the indians amongst whom he had lived . As [he]187-jefferson hope stood by the desolate fire , [he]187-jefferson hope felt that the only one thing which could assuage [his]187-jefferson hope grief would be thorough and complete retribution , brought by [his]187-jefferson hope own hand upon [[his]187-jefferson hope enemies]1185-his enemies . [His]187-jefferson hope strong will and untiring energy should , [he]187-jefferson hope determined , be devoted to that one end . With a grim , white face , [he]187-jefferson hope retraced [his]187-jefferson hope steps to where [he]187-jefferson hope had dropped the food , and having stirred up the smouldering fire , [he]187-jefferson hope cooked enough to last [him]187-jefferson hope for a few days . This [he]187-jefferson hope made up into a bundle , and , tired as [he]187-jefferson hope was , [he]187-jefferson hope set [himself]187-jefferson hope to walk back through [the mountains]680-the mountains upon the track of [the avenging angels]1187-the avenging angels .

For five days [he]187-jefferson hope toiled footsore and weary through the defiles which [he]187-jefferson hope had already traversed on horseback . At night [he]187-jefferson hope flung [himself]187-jefferson hope down among the rocks , and snatched a few hours of sleep ; but before daybreak [he]187-jefferson hope was always well on [his]187-jefferson hope way . On the sixth day , [he]187-jefferson hope reached [the Eagle Caon]92-the eagle caon , from which [they]1188-they had commenced [their]1188-they ill - fated flight . Thence [he]187-jefferson hope could look down upon [the home of [the saints]586-the saints]1189-the home of the saints . Worn and exhausted , [he]187-jefferson hope leaned upon [his]187-jefferson hope rifle and shook [his]187-jefferson hope gaunt hand fiercely at [the silent widespread city beneath [him]187-jefferson hope]1191-the silent widespread city beneath him . As [he]187-jefferson hope looked at [it]1191-the silent widespread city beneath him , [he]187-jefferson hope observed that there were flags in some of [the principal streets]1192-the principal streets , and other signs of festivity . [He]187-jefferson hope was still speculating as to what this might mean when [he]187-jefferson hope heard the clatter of horse 's hoofs , and saw [a mounted man]1193-a mounted man riding towards [him]187-jefferson hope . As [he]187-jefferson hope approached , [he]187-jefferson hope recognized [him]1193-a mounted man as [a Mormon named [Cowper]181-cowper , to whom [he]187-jefferson hope had rendered services at different times]181-cowper . [He]187-jefferson hope therefore accosted [him]1193-a mounted man when [he]187-jefferson hope got up to [him]1193-a mounted man , with the object of finding out what [Lucy Ferrier]176-lucy 's fate had been .

" [I]187-jefferson hope am [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope , "[187-jefferson hope] [he]187-jefferson hope said . " [You]1387-the man remember [me]1194-the mormon . "[1194-the mormon]

[The Mormon]1194-the mormon looked at [him]187-jefferson hope with undisguised astonishment - indeed , it was difficult to recognize in [this tattered , unkempt wanderer , with ghastly white face and fierce , wild eyes]1195-this tattered , unkempt wanderer , with ghastly white face and fierce , wild eyes , [the spruce young hunter of former days]1196-the spruce young hunter of former days . " Never mind , "[1210-a savage - looking , weather - beaten man in tattered garments] [he]187-jefferson hope answered ; and , slinging [his]187-jefferson hope weapon over [his]187-jefferson hope shoulder , strode off down [the gorge]1199-the gorge and so away into [the heart of [the mountains]680-the mountains]1200-the heart of the mountains to the haunts of the wild beasts . Amongst [them]1202-them all there was none so fierce and so dangerous as [himself]187-jefferson hope .

The prediction of [the Mormon]1194-the mormon was only too well fulfilled . Whether it was the terrible death of [[her]1204-her father]843-her father or the effects of the hateful marriage into which [she]1204-her had been forced , [poor [Lucy]176-lucy]1206-poor lucy never held up [her]1204-her head again , but pined away and died within a month . [[Her]1204-her sottish husband]1207-her sottish husband , who had married [her]1204-her principally for the sake of [[John Ferrier]175-john ferrier 's property]1208-john ferrier 's property , did not affect any great grief at [his]1207-her sottish husband bereavement ; but [[his]1207-her sottish husband other wives]1209-his other wives mourned over [her]1204-her , and sat up with [her]1204-her the night before the burial , as is the Mormon custom . [They]1202-them were grouped round the bier in the early hours of the morning , when , to [their]1202-them inexpressible fear and astonishment , the door was flung open , and [a savage - looking , weather - beaten man in tattered garments]1210-a savage - looking , weather - beaten man in tattered garments strode into [the room]259-the room . Without a glance or a word to [the cowering women]1212-the cowering women , [he]1210-a savage - looking , weather - beaten man in tattered garments walked up to the white silent figure which had once contained the pure soul of [Lucy Ferrier]176-lucy . Stooping over [her]1204-her , [he]1210-a savage - looking , weather - beaten man in tattered garments pressed [his]1210-a savage - looking , weather - beaten man in tattered garments lips reverently to [her]1204-her cold forehead , and then , snatching up [her]1204-her hand , [he]1210-a savage - looking , weather - beaten man in tattered garments took the wedding - ring from [her]1204-her finger . " [She]1204-her shall not be buried in that , "[1266-our prisoner] [he]1210-a savage - looking , weather - beaten man in tattered garments cried with a fierce snarl , and before an alarm could be raised sprang down [the stairs]393-the stairs and was gone . So strange and so brief was the episode , that [the watchers]1214-the watchers might have found it hard to believe it [themselves]1214-the watchers or persuade [other people]1215-other people of it , had it not been for the undeniable fact that the circlet of gold which marked [her]1204-her as having been [a bride]392-a bride had disappeared .

For some months [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope lingered among [the mountains]680-the mountains , leading a strange wild life , and nursing in [his]187-jefferson hope heart the fierce desire for vengeance which possessed [him]187-jefferson hope . Tales were told in the City of the weird figure which was seen prowling about [the suburbs]1218-the suburbs , and which haunted [the lonely mountain gorges]1219-the lonely mountain gorges . Once a bullet whistled through [Stangerson]174-stangerson 's window and flattened itself upon the wall within a foot of [him]187-jefferson hope . On another occasion , as [Drebber]123-drebber passed under a cliff a great boulder crashed down on [him]123-drebber , and [he]123-drebber only escaped a terrible death by throwing [himself]123-drebber upon [his]123-drebber face . [The two young Mormons]1000-the two young mormons were not long in discovering the reason of these attempts upon [their]1000-the two young mormons lives , and led repeated expeditions into [the mountains]680-the mountains in the hope of capturing or killing [[their]1000-the two young mormons enemy]1222-their enemy , but always without success . Then [they]1000-the two young mormons adopted the precaution of never going out alone or after nightfall , and of having [[their]1000-the two young mormons houses]1223-their houses guarded . After a time [they]1000-the two young mormons were able to relax these measures , for nothing was either heard or seen of [[their]1000-the two young mormons opponent]1224-their opponent , and [they]1000-the two young mormons hoped that time had cooled [his]1224-their opponent vindictiveness .

Far from doing so , it had , if anything , augmented it . [The hunter]1101-the hunter 's mind was of a hard , unyielding nature , and the predominant idea of revenge had taken such complete possession of it that there was no room for any other emotion . [He]1101-the hunter was , however , above all things practical . [He]1101-the hunter soon realized that even [his]1101-the hunter iron constitution could not stand the incessant strain which [he]1101-the hunter was putting upon it . Exposure and want of wholesome food were wearing [him]1101-the hunter out . If [he]1101-the hunter died like a dog among [the mountains]680-the mountains , what was to become of [his]1101-the hunter revenge then ? And yet such a death was sure to overtake [him]1101-the hunter if [he]1101-the hunter persisted . [He]1101-the hunter felt that that was to play [[his]1101-the hunter enemy]1227-his enemy 's game , so [he]1101-the hunter reluctantly returned to [the old Nevada mines]1228-the old nevada mines , there to recruit [his]1101-the hunter health and to amass money enough to allow [him]1101-the hunter to pursue [his]1101-the hunter object without privation .

[His]1101-the hunter intention had been to be absent a year at the most , but a combination of unforeseen circumstances prevented [his]1101-the hunter leaving [the mines]1229-the mines for nearly five . At the end of that time , however , [his]1101-the hunter memory of [his]1101-the hunter wrongs and [his]1101-the hunter craving for revenge were quite as keen as on that memorable night when [he]1101-the hunter had stood by [[John Ferrier]175-john ferrier 's grave]1230-john ferrier 's grave . Disguised , and under an assumed name , [he]1101-the hunter returned to [Salt Lake City]77-salt lake city , careless what became of [his]1101-the hunter own life , as long as [he]1101-the hunter obtained what [he]1101-the hunter knew to be justice . There [he]1101-the hunter found evil tidings awaiting [him]1101-the hunter . There had been a schism among [the Chosen People]1125-the chosen people a few months before , [some of [the younger members of the Church]1233-the younger members of the church]1232-some of the younger members of the church having rebelled against the authority of [the Elders]947-the elders , and the result had been the secession of [a certain number of the malcontents , who had left [Utah]76-utah and become [Gentiles]1236-gentiles]1235-a certain number of the malcontents , who had left utah and become gentiles . Among these had been [Drebber]123-drebber and [Stangerson]174-stangerson ; and [no one]1357-no one knew whither [they]1235-a certain number of the malcontents , who had left utah and become gentiles had gone . Rumour reported that [Drebber]123-drebber had managed to convert a large part of [[his]123-drebber property]1238-his property into money , and that [he]123-drebber had departed [a wealthy man]1239-a wealthy man , while [[his]123-drebber companion]1798-his companion , [Stangerson]174-stangerson , was comparatively poor . There was no clue at all , however , as to [their]1235-a certain number of the malcontents , who had left utah and become gentiles whereabouts .

[Many a man , however vindictive]1241-many a man , however vindictive , would have abandoned all thought of revenge in the face of such a difficulty , but [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope never faltered for a moment . With the small competence [he]187-jefferson hope possessed , eked out by such employment as [he]187-jefferson hope could pick up , [he]187-jefferson hope travelled from [town]1242-town to [town]1242-town through [the United States]93-the united states in quest of [[his]187-jefferson hope enemies]1185-his enemies . Year passed into year , [his]187-jefferson hope black hair turned grizzled , but still [he]187-jefferson hope wandered on , a human bloodhound , with [his]187-jefferson hope mind wholly set upon the one object upon which [he]187-jefferson hope had devoted [his]187-jefferson hope life . At last [his]187-jefferson hope perseverance was rewarded . It was but a glance of a face in a window , but that one glance told [him]187-jefferson hope that [Cleveland]23-cleveland in [Ohio]24-ohio possessed [the men whom [he]187-jefferson hope was in pursuit of]1245-the men whom he was in pursuit of . [He]187-jefferson hope returned to [[his]187-jefferson hope miserable lodgings]1246-his miserable lodgings with [his]187-jefferson hope plan of vengeance all arranged . It chanced , however , that [Drebber]123-drebber , looking from [his]123-drebber window , had recognized [the vagrant in [the street]329-the street]1247-the vagrant in the street , and had read murder in [his]187-jefferson hope eyes . [He]187-jefferson hope hurried before [a justice of the peace]1249-a justice of the peace , accompanied by [Stangerson]174-stangerson , who had become [[his]187-jefferson hope private secretary]503-his private secretary , and represented to [him]187-jefferson hope that [they]1251-they were in danger of [their]1251-they lives from the jealousy and hatred of [an old rival]1252-an old rival . That evening [Jefferson Hope]187-jefferson hope was taken into custody , and not being able to find sureties , was detained for some weeks . When at last [he]187-jefferson hope was liberated , it was only to find that [[Drebber]123-drebber 's house]1253-drebber 's house was deserted , and that [he]187-jefferson hope and [[his]187-jefferson hope secretary]1731-his secretary had departed for [Europe]59-europe .

Again [the avenger]1255-the avenger had been foiled , and again [his]187-jefferson hope concentrated hatred urged [him]187-jefferson hope to continue the pursuit . Funds were wanting , however , and for some time [he]187-jefferson hope had to return to work , saving every dollar for [his]187-jefferson hope approaching journey . At last , having collected enough to keep life in [him]187-jefferson hope , [he]187-jefferson hope departed for [Europe]59-europe , and tracked [[his]187-jefferson hope enemies]1185-his enemies from [city]1257-city to [city]1257-city , working [his]187-jefferson hope way in any menial capacity , but never overtaking [the fugitives]1113-the fugitives . When [he]187-jefferson hope reached [St. Petersburg]94-st. petersburg [they]1260-they had departed for [Paris]95-paris ; and when [he]187-jefferson hope followed [them]1260-they [there]205-there [he]187-jefferson hope learned that [they]1260-they had just set off for [Copenhagen]96-copenhagen . At [the Danish capital]1262-the danish capital [he]187-jefferson hope was again a few days late , for [they]1260-they had journeyed on to [London]2-london , where [he]187-jefferson hope at last succeeded in running [them]1260-they to [earth]1347-earth . As to what occurred there , [we]1264-we can not do better than quote [the old hunter]1265-the old hunter 's own account , as duly recorded in [Dr. Watson]108-dr. watson 's Journal , to which [we]1264-we are already under such obligations .

[[Our]1264-we prisoner]1266-our prisoner 's furious resistance did not apparently indicate any ferocity in [his]1266-our prisoner disposition towards [ourselves]1264-we , for on finding [himself]1266-our prisoner powerless , [he]1266-our prisoner smiled in an affable manner , and expressed [his]1266-our prisoner hopes that [he]1266-our prisoner had not hurt any of [us]1264-we in the scuffle . " Yes ; [I]1281-the official am , "[1281-the official] [I]0-i answered .

" Then put [your]0-i hand here , "[0-i] [he]1281-the official said , with a smile , motioning with [his]1281-the official manacled wrists towards [his]1281-the official chest .

[I]0-i did so ; and became at once conscious of an extraordinary throbbing and commotion which was going on inside . The walls of [his]1281-the official chest seemed to thrill and quiver as a frail building would do inside when some powerful engine was at work . In the silence of [the room]259-the room [I]0-i could hear a dull humming and buzzing noise which proceeded from the same source .

" Why , "[0-i] [I]0-i cried , " [you]1281-the official have an aortic aneurism ! "[1281-the official]

" That 's what [they]2076-they call it , "[1281-the official] [he]1281-the official said , placidly . " [I]414-the former went to [a Doctor]2075-a doctor last week about it , and [he]2075-a doctor told [me]414-the former that it is bound to burst before many days passed . It has been getting worse for years . [I]414-the former got it from over - exposure and under - feeding among [the Salt Lake Mountains]97-the salt lake mountains . [I]414-the former 've done [my]414-the former work now , and [I]414-the former do n't care how soon [I]414-the former go , but [I]414-the former should like to leave some account of the business behind [me]414-the former . [I]414-the former do n't want to be remembered as [a common cut - throat]2078-a common cut - throat . "[414-the former]

[The Inspector]1284-the inspector and [the two detectives]412-the two detectives had a hurried discussion as to the advisability of allowing [him]1281-the official to tell [his]1281-the official story .

" Do [you]0-i consider , [Doctor]157-doctor watson , that there is immediate danger ? "[0-i] [the former]414-the former asked .

" Most certainly there is , "[1284-the inspector] [I]0-i answered .

" In that case it is clearly [our]2079-our duty , in the interests of justice , to take [his]1281-the official statement , "[1284-the inspector] said [the Inspector]1284-the inspector . " [You]0-i are at liberty , [sir]1431-sir , to give [your]0-i account , which [I]582-the prisoner again warn [you]0-i will be taken down . "[582-the prisoner]

" [I]582-the prisoner 'll sit down , with [your]582-the prisoner leave , "[582-the prisoner] [the prisoner]582-the prisoner said , suiting the action to the word . " This aneurism of [mine]582-the prisoner makes [me]166-jefferson hope easily tired , and the tussle [we]2079-our had half an hour ago has not mended matters . [I]166-jefferson hope 'm on the brink of the grave , and [I]166-jefferson hope am not likely to lie to [you]582-the prisoner . Every word [I]166-jefferson hope say is the absolute truth , and how [you]582-the prisoner use it is a matter of no consequence to [me]166-jefferson hope . "[166-jefferson hope]

With these words , [Jefferson Hope]166-jefferson hope leaned back in [his]166-jefferson hope chair and began the following remarkable statement . [He]166-jefferson hope spoke in a calm and methodical manner , as though the events which [he]166-jefferson hope narrated were commonplace enough . [I]0-i can vouch for the accuracy of the subjoined account , for [I]0-i have had access to [Lestrade]119-lestrade 's note - book , in which [the prisoner]582-the prisoner 's words were taken down exactly as they were uttered .

" It do n't much matter to [you]582-the prisoner why [I]166-jefferson hope hated [these men]515-these men , "[166-jefferson hope] [he]166-jefferson hope said ; " it 's enough that [they]515-these men were guilty of the death of [two human beings]2082-two human beings - [a father]2083-a father and [a daughter]2084-a daughter - and that [they]515-these men had , therefore , forfeited [their]515-these men own lives . After the lapse of time that has passed since [their]515-these men crime , it was impossible for [me]0-i to secure a conviction against [them]515-these men in any court . [I]0-i knew of [their]515-these men guilt though , and [I]0-i determined that [I]0-i should be [judge]2085-judge , [jury]2086-jury , and [executioner]2087-executioner all rolled into one . [You]582-the prisoner 'd have done the same , if [you]582-the prisoner have any manhood in [you]582-the prisoner , if [you]582-the prisoner had been in [[my]0-i place]2088-my place .[0-i]

" [That girl that [I]166-jefferson hope spoke of]2089-that girl that i spoke of was to have married [me]166-jefferson hope twenty years ago . [She]2089-that girl that i spoke of was forced into marrying [that same Drebber]2090-that same drebber , and broke [her]2089-that girl that i spoke of heart over it . [I]166-jefferson hope took the marriage ring from [her]2089-that girl that i spoke of dead finger , and [I]166-jefferson hope vowed that [his]2090-that same drebber dying eyes should rest upon that very ring , and that [his]2090-that same drebber last thoughts should be of the crime for which [he]2090-that same drebber was punished . [I]166-jefferson hope have carried it about with [me]166-jefferson hope , and have followed [him]2090-that same drebber and [[his]2090-that same drebber accomplice]2091-his accomplice over [two continents]2092-two continents until [I]166-jefferson hope caught [them]2093-they . [They]2093-they thought to tire [me]166-jefferson hope out , but [they]2093-they could not do it . If [I]166-jefferson hope die to - morrow , as is likely enough , [I]166-jefferson hope die knowing that [my]166-jefferson hope work in [this world]1564-this world is done , and well done . [They]2093-they have perished , and by [my]166-jefferson hope hand . There is nothing left for [me]166-jefferson hope to hope for , or to desire .[166-jefferson hope]

" [They]2093-they were rich and [I]0-i was poor , so that it was no easy matter for [me]0-i to follow [them]2093-they . When [I]0-i got to [London]2-london [my]0-i pocket was about empty , and [I]0-i found that [I]0-i must turn [my]0-i hand to something for [my]0-i living . Driving and riding are as natural to [me]0-i as walking , so [I]0-i applied at [[a cabowner]2095-a cabowner 's office]2096-a cabowner 's office , and soon got employment . [I]0-i was to bring a certain sum a week to [the owner]2097-the owner , and whatever was over that [I]0-i might keep for [myself]0-i . There was seldom much over , but [I]0-i managed to scrape along somehow . The hardest job was to learn [my]0-i way about , for [I]0-i reckon that of all the mazes that ever were contrived , [this city]2098-this city is the most confusing . [I]0-i had a map beside [me]0-i though , and when once [I]0-i had spotted [the principal hotels]2099-the principal hotels and [stations]2100-stations , [I]0-i got on pretty well .[0-i]

" It was some time before [I]166-jefferson hope found out where [[my]166-jefferson hope two gentlemen]2101-my two gentlemen were living ; but [I]166-jefferson hope inquired and inquired until at last [I]166-jefferson hope dropped across [them]2101-my two gentlemen . [They]2101-my two gentlemen were at [a boarding - house at [Camberwell]45-camberwell]2102-a boarding - house at camberwell , over on [the other side of [the river]1882-the river]2103-the other side of the river . When once [I]166-jefferson hope found [them]2101-my two gentlemen out [I]166-jefferson hope knew that [I]166-jefferson hope had [them]2101-my two gentlemen at [my]166-jefferson hope mercy . [I]166-jefferson hope had grown [my]166-jefferson hope beard , and there was no chance of [their]2101-my two gentlemen recognizing [me]166-jefferson hope . [I]166-jefferson hope would dog [them]2101-my two gentlemen and follow [them]2101-my two gentlemen until [I]166-jefferson hope saw [my]166-jefferson hope opportunity . [I]166-jefferson hope was determined that [they]2101-my two gentlemen should not escape [me]166-jefferson hope again .[166-jefferson hope]

" [They]2101-my two gentlemen were very near doing it for all that . Go where [they]2101-my two gentlemen would about [London]2-london , [I]0-i was always at [their]2101-my two gentlemen heels . Sometimes [I]0-i followed [them]2101-my two gentlemen on [[my]0-i cab]2069-my cab , and sometimes on foot , but the former was the best , for then [they]2101-my two gentlemen could not get away from [me]0-i . It was only early in the morning or late at night that [I]0-i could earn anything , so that [I]0-i began to get behind hand with [[my]0-i employer]2106-my employer . [I]0-i did not mind that , however , as long as [I]0-i could lay [my]0-i hand upon [the men]2107-the men [I]0-i wanted .[0-i]

" [They]2101-my two gentlemen were very cunning , though . [They]2101-my two gentlemen must have thought that there was some chance of [their]2101-my two gentlemen being followed , for [they]2101-my two gentlemen would never go out alone , and never after nightfall . During two weeks [I]166-jefferson hope drove behind [them]2101-my two gentlemen every day , and never once saw [them]2101-my two gentlemen separate . [Drebber]123-drebber [himself]123-drebber was drunk half the time , but [Stangerson]174-stangerson was not to be caught napping . [I]166-jefferson hope watched [them]2101-my two gentlemen late and early , but never saw the ghost of a chance ; but [I]166-jefferson hope was not discouraged , for something told [me]166-jefferson hope that the hour had almost come . [My]166-jefferson hope only fear was that this thing in [my]166-jefferson hope chest might burst a little too soon and leave [my]166-jefferson hope work undone .[166-jefferson hope]

" At last , one evening [I]0-i was driving up and down [Torquay Terrace]44-torquay terrace , as [the street]329-the street was called in which [they]2101-my two gentlemen boarded , when [I]0-i saw [a cab]1467-a cab drive up to [their]2101-my two gentlemen door . Presently some luggage was brought out , and after a time [Drebber]123-drebber and [Stangerson]174-stangerson followed [it]1467-a cab , and drove off . [I]0-i whipped up [my]0-i horse and kept within sight of [them]2101-my two gentlemen , feeling very ill at ease , for [I]0-i feared that [they]2101-my two gentlemen were going to shift [[their]2101-my two gentlemen quarters]2110-their quarters . At [Euston Station]46-euston station [they]2101-my two gentlemen got out , and [I]0-i left [a boy]891-a boy to hold [my]0-i horse , and followed [them]2101-my two gentlemen on to [the platform]506-the platform . [I]0-i heard [them]2101-my two gentlemen ask for [the Liverpool train]2113-the liverpool train , and [the guard]2114-the guard answer that [one]386-one had just gone and there would not be another for some hours . [Stangerson]174-stangerson seemed to be put out at that , but [Drebber]123-drebber was rather pleased than otherwise . [I]0-i got so close to [them]2101-my two gentlemen in the bustle that [I]0-i could hear every word that passed between [them]2101-my two gentlemen . [Drebber]123-drebber said that [he]123-drebber had a little business of [his]123-drebber own to do , and that if [the other]569-the other would wait for [him]123-drebber [he]123-drebber would soon rejoin [him]123-drebber . [[His]123-drebber companion]1798-his companion remonstrated with [him]123-drebber , and reminded [him]123-drebber that [they]2101-my two gentlemen had resolved to stick together . [Drebber]123-drebber answered that the matter was a delicate one , and that [he]123-drebber must go alone . [I]0-i could not catch what [Stangerson]174-stangerson said to that , but [the other]569-the other burst out swearing , and reminded [him]123-drebber that [he]123-drebber was nothing more than [[his]123-drebber paid servant]2119-his paid servant , and that [he]123-drebber must not presume to dictate to [him]123-drebber . On that [the Secretary]516-the secretary gave it up as a bad job , and simply bargained with [him]123-drebber that if [he]123-drebber missed [the last train]2121-the last train [he]123-drebber should rejoin [him]123-drebber at [Halliday 's Private Hotel]57-halliday 's private hotel ; to which [Drebber]123-drebber answered that [he]123-drebber would be back on [the platform]506-the platform before eleven , and made [his]123-drebber way out of [the station]1594-the station .[0-i]

" The moment for which [I]166-jefferson hope had waited so long had at last come . [I]166-jefferson hope had [[my]166-jefferson hope enemies]2124-my enemies within [my]166-jefferson hope power . Together [they]2124-my enemies could protect [each other]413-each other , but singly [they]2124-my enemies were at [my]166-jefferson hope mercy . [I]166-jefferson hope did not act , however , with undue precipitation . [My]166-jefferson hope plans were already formed . There is no satisfaction in vengeance unless [the offender]2126-the offender has time to realize who it is that strikes [him]2126-the offender , and why retribution has come upon [him]2126-the offender . [I]166-jefferson hope had [my]166-jefferson hope plans arranged by which [I]166-jefferson hope should have the opportunity of making [the man who had wronged [me]166-jefferson hope understand that [his]2127-the man who had wronged me understand that his old sin old sin]2127-the man who had wronged me understand that his old sin had found [him]2127-the man who had wronged me understand that his old sin out . It was claimed that same evening , and returned ; but in the interval [I]166-jefferson hope had taken a moulding of it , and had a duplicate constructed . By means of this [I]166-jefferson hope had access to at least [one spot in [this great city]1859-this great city where [I]166-jefferson hope could rely upon being free from interruption]2132-one spot in this great city where i could rely upon being free from interruption . How to get [Drebber]123-drebber to [that house]2134-that house was the difficult problem which [I]166-jefferson hope had now to solve .[166-jefferson hope]

" [He]123-drebber walked down [the road]1633-the road and went into [one or two liquor shops]2136-one or two liquor shops , staying for nearly half - an - hour in the last of [them]2136-one or two liquor shops . When [he]123-drebber came out [he]123-drebber staggered in [his]123-drebber walk , and was evidently pretty well on . There was a hansom just in front of [me]1292-i , and [he]123-drebber hailed it . [I]1292-i followed it so close that the nose of [my]1292-i horse was within a yard of [[his]123-drebber driver]2137-his driver the whole way . [We]2138-we rattled across [Waterloo Bridge]100-waterloo bridge and through miles of [streets]2139-streets , until , to [my]1292-i astonishment , [we]2138-we found [ourselves]2138-we back in [the Terrace in which [he]123-drebber had boarded]2140-the terrace in which he had boarded . " That 's better , "[1292-i] [he]1292-i said . " Well , [I]166-jefferson hope waited for a quarter of an hour , or more , when suddenly there came a noise like [people]2144-people struggling inside [the house]1453-the house . Next moment the door was flung open and [two men]1545-two men appeared , [one of whom was [Drebber]123-drebber]2147-one of whom was drebber , and [the other]569-the other was [a young chap whom [I]166-jefferson hope had never seen before]2149-a young chap whom i had never seen before . [This fellow]1341-this fellow had [Drebber]123-drebber by the collar , and when [they]1545-two men came to the head of [the steps]2151-the steps [he]1341-this fellow gave [him]123-drebber a shove and a kick which sent [him]123-drebber half across [the road]1633-the road . ' [You]166-jefferson hope hound , ' [he]1341-this fellow cried , shaking [his]1341-this fellow stick at [him]166-jefferson hope ; ' [I]166-jefferson hope 'll teach [you]166-jefferson hope to insult [an honest girl]2153-an honest girl ! ' [He]1341-this fellow was so hot that [I]166-jefferson hope think [he]1341-this fellow would have thrashed [Drebber]123-drebber with [his]1341-this fellow cudgel , only that [the cur]2154-the cur staggered away down [the road]1633-the road as fast as [his]1341-this fellow legs would carry [him]1341-this fellow . [He]1341-this fellow ran as far as the corner , and then , seeing [[my]166-jefferson hope cab]2069-my cab , [he]1341-this fellow hailed [me]166-jefferson hope and jumped in . ' Drive [me]166-jefferson hope to [Halliday 's Private Hotel]57-halliday 's private hotel , ' said [he]1341-this fellow .[166-jefferson hope]

" When [I]1292-i had [him]1341-this fellow fairly inside [[my]1292-i cab]2069-my cab , [my]1292-i heart jumped so with joy that [I]1292-i feared lest at this last moment [my]1292-i aneurism might go wrong . [I]1292-i drove along slowly , weighing in [my]1292-i own mind what it was best to do . [I]1292-i might take [him]1341-this fellow right out into [the country]231-the country , and there in [some deserted lane]2159-some deserted lane have [my]1292-i last interview with [him]1341-this fellow . [I]1292-i had almost decided upon this , when [he]1341-this fellow solved the problem for [me]1292-i . The craze for drink had seized [him]1341-this fellow again , and [he]1341-this fellow ordered [me]1292-i to pull up outside [a gin palace]2160-a gin palace . [He]1341-this fellow went in , leaving word that [I]1292-i should wait for [him]1341-this fellow . There [he]1341-this fellow remained until closing time , and when [he]1341-this fellow came out [he]1341-this fellow was so far gone that [I]1292-i knew the game was in [my]1292-i own hands .[1292-i]

" Do n't imagine that [I]166-jefferson hope intended to kill [him]1341-this fellow in cold blood . It would only have been rigid justice if [I]166-jefferson hope had done so , but [I]166-jefferson hope could not bring [myself]166-jefferson hope to do it . [I]166-jefferson hope had long determined that [he]1341-this fellow should have a show for [his]1341-this fellow life if [he]1341-this fellow chose to take advantage of it . Among the many billets which [I]166-jefferson hope have filled in [America]43-america during [my]166-jefferson hope wandering life , [I]166-jefferson hope was [once janitor and sweeper out of [the laboratory at [York College]101-york college]2162-the laboratory at york college]2161-once janitor and sweeper out of the laboratory at york college . One day [the professor]2163-the professor was lecturing on poisons , and [he]2163-the professor showed [[his]2163-the professor students]2164-his students some alkaloid , as [he]2163-the professor called it , which [he]2163-the professor had extracted from some South American arrow poison , and which was so powerful that the least grain meant instant death . [I]166-jefferson hope spotted the bottle in which this preparation was kept , and when they were all gone , [I]166-jefferson hope helped [myself]166-jefferson hope to a little of it . [I]166-jefferson hope was [a fairly good dispenser]2165-a fairly good dispenser , so [I]166-jefferson hope worked this alkaloid into small , soluble pills , and each pill [I]166-jefferson hope put in a box with a similar pill made without the poison . [I]166-jefferson hope determined at the time that when [I]166-jefferson hope had [my]166-jefferson hope chance , [[my]166-jefferson hope gentlemen]2166-my gentlemen should each have a draw out of one of these boxes , while [I]166-jefferson hope ate the pill that remained . It would be quite as deadly , and a good deal less noisy than firing across a handkerchief . From that day [I]166-jefferson hope had always [my]166-jefferson hope pill boxes about with [me]166-jefferson hope , and the time had now come when [I]166-jefferson hope was to use them .[166-jefferson hope]

" It was nearer one than twelve , and a wild , bleak night , blowing hard and raining in torrents . Dismal as it was outside , [I]1292-i was glad within - so glad that [I]1292-i could have shouted out from pure exultation . If [any of [you]2168-you gentlemen]2167-any of you gentlemen have ever pined for a thing , and longed for it during twenty long years , and then suddenly found it within [your]2168-you reach , [you]2168-you would understand [my]1292-i feelings . [I]1292-i lit a cigar , and puffed at it to steady [my]1292-i nerves , but [my]1292-i hands were trembling , and [my]1292-i temples throbbing with excitement . As [I]1292-i drove , [I]1292-i could see [old John Ferrier]175-john ferrier and [sweet Lucy]176-lucy looking at [me]1292-i out of the darkness and smiling at [me]1292-i , just as plain as [I]1292-i see [you]2168-you all in [this room]1378-this room . All the way [they]2168-you were ahead of [me]1292-i , one on each side of the horse until [I]1292-i pulled up at [the house in [the Brixton Road]1475-the brixton road]2170-the house in the brixton road .[1292-i]

" There was not [a soul to be seen , nor a sound to be heard]2172-a soul to be seen , nor a sound to be heard , except the dripping of the rain . When [I]166-jefferson hope looked in at the window , [I]166-jefferson hope found [Drebber]123-drebber all huddled together in a drunken sleep . [I]166-jefferson hope shook [him]123-drebber by the arm , ' It 's time to get out , ' [I]166-jefferson hope said .[166-jefferson hope]

" ' All right , [cabby]2173-cabby , ' said [he]123-drebber .[1292-i]

" [I]166-jefferson hope suppose [he]123-drebber thought [we]2174-we had come to [the hotel]232-the hotel that [he]123-drebber had mentioned , for [he]123-drebber got out without another word , and followed [me]166-jefferson hope down [the garden]354-the garden . [I]166-jefferson hope had to walk beside [him]123-drebber to keep [him]123-drebber steady , for [he]123-drebber was still a little top - heavy . When [we]2174-we came to the door , [I]166-jefferson hope opened it , and led [him]123-drebber into [the front room]1454-the front room . [I]166-jefferson hope give [you]123-drebber [my]166-jefferson hope word that all the way , [the father]851-the father and [the daughter]1727-the daughter were walking in front of [us]2174-we .[166-jefferson hope]

" ' It 's infernally dark , ' said [he]123-drebber , stamping about .[1292-i]

" ' [We]2174-we 'll soon have a light , ' [I]166-jefferson hope said , striking a match and putting it to a wax candle which [I]166-jefferson hope had brought with [me]166-jefferson hope . ' Now , [Enoch Drebber]123-drebber , ' [I]166-jefferson hope continued , turning to [him]123-drebber , and holding the light to [my]166-jefferson hope own face , ' who am [I]166-jefferson hope ? '[166-jefferson hope]

" [He]123-drebber gazed at [me]1292-i with bleared , drunken eyes for a moment , and then [I]1292-i saw a horror spring up in them , and convulse [his]123-drebber whole features , which showed [me]1292-i that [he]123-drebber knew [me]1292-i . [He]123-drebber staggered back with a livid face , and [I]1292-i saw the perspiration break out upon [his]123-drebber brow , while [his]123-drebber teeth chattered in [his]123-drebber head . At the sight , [I]1292-i leaned [my]1292-i back against the door and laughed loud and long . [I]1292-i had always known that vengeance would be sweet , but [I]1292-i had never hoped for the contentment of soul which now possessed [me]1292-i .[1292-i]

" ' [You]123-drebber dog ! ' [I]166-jefferson hope said ; ' [I]166-jefferson hope have hunted [you]123-drebber from [Salt Lake City]77-salt lake city to [St. Petersburg]94-st. petersburg , and [you]123-drebber have always escaped [me]166-jefferson hope . Now , at last [your]123-drebber wanderings have come to an end , for either [you]123-drebber or [I]166-jefferson hope shall never see to - morrow 's sun rise . ' [He]123-drebber shrunk still further away as [I]166-jefferson hope spoke , and [I]166-jefferson hope could see on [his]123-drebber face that [he]123-drebber thought [I]166-jefferson hope was mad . So [I]166-jefferson hope was for the time . The pulses in [my]166-jefferson hope temples beat like sledge - hammers , and [I]166-jefferson hope believe [I]166-jefferson hope would have had a fit of some sort if the blood had not gushed from [my]166-jefferson hope nose and relieved [me]166-jefferson hope .[166-jefferson hope]

" ' What do [you]123-drebber think of [Lucy Ferrier]176-lucy now ? ' [I]1292-i cried , locking the door , and shaking the key in [his]123-drebber face . ' Punishment has been slow in coming , but it has overtaken [you]123-drebber at last . ' [I]1292-i saw [his]123-drebber coward lips tremble as [I]1292-i spoke . [He]123-drebber would have begged for [his]123-drebber life , but [he]123-drebber knew well that it was useless .[1292-i]

" ' Would [you]1292-i murder [me]166-jefferson hope ? ' [he]123-drebber stammered .[166-jefferson hope]

" ' There is no murder , ' [I]1292-i answered . ' Who talks of murdering [a mad dog]2180-a mad dog ? '[1292-i]

" ' It was not [I]166-jefferson hope who killed [[her]2181-my poor darling father]843-her father , ' [he]123-drebber cried .[166-jefferson hope]

" [He]123-drebber cowered away with wild cries and prayers for mercy , but [I]166-jefferson hope drew [my]166-jefferson hope knife and held it to [his]123-drebber throat until [he]123-drebber had obeyed [me]166-jefferson hope . [He]123-drebber was dead ![166-jefferson hope]

" The blood had been streaming from [my]1292-i nose , but [I]1292-i had taken no notice of it . [I]1292-i do n't know what it was that put it into [my]1292-i head to write upon the wall with it . Perhaps it was some mischievous idea of setting [the police]362-the police upon [a wrong track]2190-a wrong track , for [I]1292-i felt light - hearted and cheerful . [I]1292-i remembered [a German]1555-a german being found in [New York]31-new york with [RACHE]131-rache written up above [him]1555-a german , and it was argued at the time in the newspapers that [the secret societies]2192-the secret societies must have done it . Then [I]1292-i walked down to [[my]1292-i cab]2069-my cab and found that there was [nobody]2195-nobody about , and that the night was still very wild . " That was how [Enoch Drebber]123-drebber came to [his]123-drebber end . " [I]110-holmes have little more to say , and it 's as well , for [I]110-holmes am about done up . " Simple ! "[110-holmes] [I]0-i ejaculated .

" That is true , "[110-holmes] said [I.]0-i

" [I]0-i have already explained to [you]0-i that what is out of the common is usually a guide rather than a hindrance . In solving a problem of this sort , the grand thing is to be able to reason backwards . That is a very useful accomplishment , and a very easy one , but [people]2144-people do not practise it much . In the every - day affairs of life it is more useful to reason forwards , and so the other comes to be neglected . There are fifty who can reason synthetically for one who can reason analytically . "[0-i]

" [I]0-i confess , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " that [I]110-holmes do not quite follow [you]166-jefferson hope . "[110-holmes]

" [I]1311-i hardly expected that [you]0-i would . Let [me]1311-i see if [I]1311-i can make it clearer . [Most people]2225-most people , if [you]0-i describe a train of events to [them]2225-most people , will tell [you]0-i what the result would be . [They]2225-most people can put those events together in [their]2225-most people minds , and argue from [them]2225-most people that something will come to pass . There are [few people]2226-few people , however , who , if [you]0-i told [them]2225-most people a result , would be able to evolve from [their]2225-most people own inner consciousness what the steps were which led up to that result . This power is what [I]1311-i mean when [I]1311-i talk of reasoning backwards , or analytically . "[1311-i]

" [I]110-holmes understand , "[110-holmes] said [I.]1311-i

" Now this was a case in which [you]0-i were given the result and had to find everything else for [yourself]0-i . Now let [me]110-holmes endeavour to show [you]0-i the different steps in [my]110-holmes reasoning . To begin at the beginning . [I]110-holmes approached [the house]1453-the house , as [you]0-i know , on foot , and with [my]110-holmes mind entirely free from all impressions . [I]110-holmes naturally began by examining [the roadway]332-the roadway , and there , as [I]110-holmes have already explained to [you]0-i , [I]110-holmes saw clearly the marks of [a cab]1467-a cab , which , [I]110-holmes ascertained by inquiry , must have been there during the night . [I]110-holmes satisfied [myself]110-holmes that it was [a cab]1467-a cab and not [a private carriage]2231-a private carriage by the narrow gauge of the wheels . The ordinary [London]2-london growler is considerably less wide than [a gentleman]1455-a gentleman 's brougham .[110-holmes]

" This was the first point gained . [I]110-holmes then walked slowly down [the garden path]2233-the garden path , which happened to be composed of [a clay soil]2234-a clay soil , peculiarly suitable for taking impressions . No doubt it appeared to [you]0-i to be a mere trampled line of slush , but to [my]110-holmes trained eyes every mark upon its surface had a meaning . There is no branch of detective science which is so important and so much neglected as the art of tracing footsteps . Happily , [I]110-holmes have always laid great stress upon it , and much practice has made it second nature to [me]110-holmes . [I]110-holmes saw the heavy footmarks of [the constables]2235-the constables , but [I]110-holmes saw also the track of [the two men who had first passed through [the garden]354-the garden]2236-the two men who had first passed through the garden . It was easy to tell that [they]2236-the two men who had first passed through the garden had been before [the others]755-the others , because in places [their]2236-the two men who had first passed through the garden marks had been entirely obliterated by [the others coming upon the top of [them]2236-the two men who had first passed through the garden]2239-the others coming upon the top of them . In this way [my]110-holmes second link was formed , which told [me]110-holmes that [the nocturnal visitors]2240-the nocturnal visitors were two in number , one remarkable for [his]2241-his height ( as [I]110-holmes calculated from the length of [his]2241-his stride ) , and the other fashionably dressed , to judge from the small and elegant impression left by [his]2241-his boots .[110-holmes]

" On entering [the house]1453-the house this last inference was confirmed . [[My]110-holmes well - booted man]2243-my well - booted man lay before [me]110-holmes . [The tall one]2244-the tall one , then , had done the murder , if murder there was . There was no wound upon [[the dead man]381-the dead man 's person]2246-the dead man 's person , but the agitated expression upon [his]381-the dead man face assured [me]110-holmes that [he]381-the dead man had foreseen [his]381-the dead man fate before it came upon [him]381-the dead man . [Men who die from heart disease , or any sudden natural cause]2247-men who die from heart disease , or any sudden natural cause , never by any chance exhibit agitation upon [their]2247-men who die from heart disease , or any sudden natural cause features . Having sniffed [the dead man]381-the dead man 's lips [I]110-holmes detected a slightly sour smell , and [I]110-holmes came to the conclusion that [he]381-the dead man had had poison forced upon [him]381-the dead man . Again , [I]110-holmes argued that it had been forced upon [him]381-the dead man from the hatred and fear expressed upon [his]381-the dead man face . By the method of exclusion , [I]110-holmes had arrived at this result , for no other hypothesis would meet the facts . Do not imagine that it was a very unheard of idea . The forcible administration of poison is by no means a new thing in criminal annals . The cases of [Dolsky]198-dolsky in [Odessa]103-odessa , and of [Leturier]199-leturier in [Montpellier]17-montpellier , will occur at once to [any toxicologist]2249-any toxicologist .[110-holmes]

" And now came the great question as to the reason why . [Robbery]200-robbery had not been the object of the murder , for nothing was taken . Was it politics , then , or was it [a woman]1493-a woman ? That was the question which confronted [me]110-holmes . [I]110-holmes was inclined from the first to the latter supposition . [Political assassins]2251-political assassins are only too glad to do [their]2251-political assassins work and to fly . This murder had , on the contrary , been done most deliberately , and [the perpetrator]2252-the perpetrator had left [his]2252-the perpetrator tracks all over [the room]259-the room , showing that [he]2252-the perpetrator had been [there]205-there all the time . It must have been a private wrong , and not a political one , which called for such a methodical revenge . When the inscription was discovered upon the wall [I]110-holmes was more inclined than ever to [my]110-holmes opinion . The thing was too evidently a blind . When the ring was found , however , it settled the question . Clearly [the murderer]1489-the murderer had used it to remind [[his]1489-the murderer victim]1523-his victim of [some dead or absent woman]2257-some dead or absent woman . It was at this point that [I]110-holmes asked [Gregson]130-gregson whether [he]130-gregson had enquired in [his]130-gregson telegram to [Cleveland]23-cleveland as to any particular point in [Mr. Drebber]123-drebber 's former career . [He]130-gregson answered , [you]110-holmes remember , in the negative .[110-holmes]

" [I]110-holmes then proceeded to make a careful examination of [the room]259-the room , which confirmed [me]110-holmes in [my]110-holmes opinion as to [the murderer]1489-the murderer 's height , and furnished [me]110-holmes with the additional details as to the Trichinopoly cigar and the length of [his]1489-the murderer nails . [I]110-holmes had already come to the conclusion , since there were no signs of a struggle , that the blood which covered the floor had burst from [the murderer]1489-the murderer 's nose in [his]1489-the murderer excitement . [I]110-holmes could perceive that the track of blood coincided with the track of [his]1489-the murderer feet . It is seldom that [any man]1997-any man , unless [he]1997-any man is very full - blooded , breaks out in this way through emotion , so [I]110-holmes hazarded the opinion that [the criminal]2223-the criminal was probably [a robust and ruddy - faced man]2263-a robust and ruddy - faced man . Events proved that [I]110-holmes had judged correctly .[110-holmes]

" Having left [the house]1453-the house , [I]110-holmes proceeded to do what [Gregson]130-gregson had neglected . [I]110-holmes telegraphed to [the head of [the police at [Cleveland]23-cleveland]2266-the police at cleveland]2265-the head of the police at cleveland , limiting [my]110-holmes enquiry to the circumstances connected with the marriage of [Enoch Drebber]123-drebber . [It]2267-it told [me]110-holmes that [Drebber]123-drebber had already applied for the protection of the law against [an old rival in love]2268-an old rival in love , named [Jefferson Hope]166-jefferson hope , and that [this same Hope]2269-this same hope was at present in [Europe]59-europe . [I]110-holmes knew now that [I]110-holmes held the clue to the mystery in [my]110-holmes hand , and all that remained was to secure [the murderer]1489-the murderer .[110-holmes]

" [I]110-holmes had already determined in [my]110-holmes own mind that [the man who had walked into [the house]1453-the house with [Drebber]123-drebber]2271-the man who had walked into the house with drebber , was none other than [the man who had driven [the cab]1529-the cab]2273-the man who had driven the cab . The marks in [the road]1633-the road showed [me]110-holmes that the horse had wandered on in a way which would have been impossible had there been [anyone in charge of it]2276-anyone in charge of it . Where , then , could [the driver]420-the driver be , unless [he]420-the driver were inside [the house]1453-the house ? Again , it is absurd to suppose that [any sane man]2279-any sane man would carry out a deliberate crime under the very eyes , as it were , of [a third person]2280-a third person , who was sure to betray [him]2279-any sane man . Lastly , supposing [one man]1548-one man wished to dog another through [London]2-london , what better means could [he]1548-one man adopt than to turn cabdriver . All these considerations led [me]110-holmes to the irresistible conclusion that [Jefferson Hope]166-jefferson hope was to be found among [the jarveys of [the Metropolis]230-the metropolis]2282-the jarveys of the metropolis .[110-holmes]

" If [he]166-jefferson hope had been [one]386-one there was no reason to believe that [he]166-jefferson hope had ceased to be . On the contrary , from [his]166-jefferson hope point of view , any sudden change would be likely to draw attention to [himself]166-jefferson hope . [He]166-jefferson hope would , probably , for a time at least , continue to perform [his]166-jefferson hope duties . There was no reason to suppose that [he]166-jefferson hope was going under an assumed name . Why should [he]166-jefferson hope change [his]166-jefferson hope name in [a country where [no one]1357-no one knew [his]166-jefferson hope original one]2285-a country where no one knew his original one ? [I]0-i therefore organized [[my]0-i Street Arab [detective corps]2288-detective corps]2287-my street arab detective corps , and sent [them]2287-my street arab detective corps systematically to [every cab proprietor in [London]2-london]2289-every cab proprietor in london until [they]2287-my street arab detective corps ferreted out [the man that [I]0-i wanted]2290-the man that i wanted . Through it , as [you]2291-you know , [I]0-i came into possession of the pills , the existence of which [I]0-i had already surmised . " It is wonderful ! "[0-i] [I]0-i cried . " [Your]2291-you merits should be publicly recognized . [You]2291-you should publish an account of the case . If [you]2291-you wo n't , [I]1312-he will for [you]2291-you . "[1312-he]

" [You]0-i may do what [you]0-i like , [Doctor]1519-doctor , "[1312-he] [he]1312-he answered . " See here ! "[1312-he] [he]1312-he continued , handing a paper over to [me]0-i , " look at this ! "[0-i]

It was the _ Echo _ for the day , and the paragraph to which [he]1312-he pointed was devoted to the case in question .

" [The public]2293-the public , "[0-i] it said , " have lost a sensational treat through the sudden death of [the man Hope , who was suspected of the murder of [Mr. Enoch Drebber]123-drebber and of [Mr. Joseph Stangerson]128-stangerson]2294-the man hope , who was suspected of the murder of mr. enoch drebber and of mr. joseph stangerson . The details of the case will probably be never known now , though [we]2295-we are informed upon good authority that the crime was the result of an old standing and romantic feud , in which love and Mormonism bore a part . It seems that both [the victims]2296-the victims belonged , in [their]2296-the victims younger days , to [the Latter Day Saints]2297-the latter day saints , and [Hope]166-jefferson hope , [the deceased prisoner]2298-the deceased prisoner , hails also from [Salt Lake City]77-salt lake city . If the case has had no other effect , it , at least , brings out in the most striking manner the efficiency of [[our]2295-we detective police force]2299-our detective police force , and will serve as a lesson to [all foreigners]2300-all foreigners that [they]2300-all foreigners will do wisely to settle [their]2300-all foreigners feuds at [home]1598-home , and not to carry [them]2300-all foreigners on to [British soil]2302-british soil .
